node.description:
Backend Software Engineer (Python)

We're looking for a Python Developer to join our growing software development team that supports our growing platforms. This position will have the opportunity to work on both current and new features that are deployed to our internal and external users. Initially, the Python Developer will spend time getting familiar with our standards and code base. The ideal candidate will be comfortable ramping up quickly so that they can create and maintain services and data solutions that deliver value to tens of thousands of our platform users. This person will be responsible for creating clean, scalable, standards-compliant, reusable, and quality code. In addition, they will contribute to the continuous growth and learning of the software development team as a whole. Hiring the right person for this role is important to our team because they will be a part of the production and continuous improvement of our products.

Core Responsibilities:

  • Participate in the overall application lifecycle
  • Collaborate with front end developers
  • Troubleshoot and debug
  • Learn about new technologies which may be scalable to our dev-ops organization as a whole
  • Create and maintain compliant back end services
  • Create, integrate, and manage databases that support key product features
  • Help define and communicate technical and design requirements

Key Competencies/Requirements: 

  • 3+ years professional experience as a software engineer 
  • 2+ years experience coding in Python programming language 
  • 2+ years experience in database management
  • 2+ years experience using code versioning tools like Git
  • Understanding of database tools, specifically PostgreSQL
  • Experience creating database schemas which meet business requirements
  • In-depth understanding of API specifications, specifically RESTFUL APIs
  • In-depth understanding of the fundamental design principles behind scalable applications
  • Openness to learning and sharing knowledge
  • Ability to write clean, scalable, standards-compliant, reusable, quality code

Additional Preferred Requirements: 

  • Experience with Django
  • Experience working in Swagger
  • Experience with GCP services like CloudSQL, Kubernetes 
  • Experience programming in GoLang 
  • Experience integrating applications with payment providers like Stripe, Dwolla, etc.

Legal authorization to work in the United States is a precondition to employment at AcreTrader.

JOB CODE: 1000033
node.title: Backend Software Engineer

node.description:
We're looking for Snack Baristas who are obsessed with ensuring our guests have an amazing experience every time they are in our store. They will conduct sales transactions, have a deep knowledge of our products and ingredients, and work behind the bar to make and serve food items like smoothies and breakfast bowls. Previous restaurant, bar, grocery store, or coffee shop experience preferred.


Why should you work at Snack Lab? We offer competitive base pay plus tips. You’ll get to be a part of a company actively working to positively impact our community through healthy eating and encouragement. You get to come to work and be a part of a great team! We offer employee discounts on food and free meals with each shift.


Competitive pay- hourly PLUS tips. Must have daytime availability at least 3-4 days Monday-Saturday.
node.title: Snack Baristas

node.description:
AcreTrader is looking for an experienced analyst or financial professional to join its farm team. The Investment Analyst will assist the team in identifying and educating agricultural professionals to partner with and bring investment opportunities to the AcreTrader platform. AcreTrader’s financing model strives to create a mutually beneficial relationship between growers and investors on the AcreTrader platform. The candidate should be advanced in financial modeling and demonstrate the ability to conduct primary research on various crop types, including gaining an understanding of both economic and agronomic factors affecting farm profitability and returns. In addition to financial modeling competency, candidates should have the interpersonal skills to build on AcreTrader's existing network of farm operators.  

We are looking for candidates who want to join a fast growing team building a new approach to financing and investing in farmland. In addition to due diligence, team members help bring compelling opportunities to the platform and educate potential partners on the benefits of the AcreTrader platform. 

 Core Responsibilities: 

  • Conduct fundamental analysis of project opportunities, including in-depth financial modeling and return analysis
  • Build relationships with potential partners (farmers, growers, operators, brokers) to bring opportunities to the platform
  • Build a network of industry contacts to conduct primary research on both partner and investment opportunities
  • As at any growing company, you can expect many other tasks and responsibilities to be assigned as well as growth opportunities to be seized

 Key Competencies/Requirements: 

  • Understanding of financial modeling, ideally financial modeling for farmland and/or real estate transactions
  • Ability to conduct valuation analysis to identify relative attractiveness of a given opportunity
  • Ability to clearly and convincingly communicate investment structures to potential partners
  • Ability to conduct primary and secondary research to quickly identify the key factors for an investment opportunity
  • Ability to clearly and concisely convey, both orally and in writing, findings of fundamental analysis
  • Candidates will be required to achieve FINRA SIE, 63, and 79 licenses within the first 90 days of employment. (AcreTrader will sponsor these licenses.)  
  • Local to Fayetteville, AR or willing to relocate

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5+ years of experience in agricultural finance, real estate finance, investment analysis, investment banking or similar field
  • Experience building and analyzing financial models and returns
  • Experience with project development and client/contract management
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills 
  • Background in agriculture

 Legal authorization to work in the United States is a precondition to employment at AcreTrader.

About AcreTrader

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and in order to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, read on.

AcreTrader is a real estate investing platform that makes it easy to buy shares of farmland and earn passive income. United States farmland has historically outperformed most asset classes and other forms of real estate. Unfortunately, buying and maintaining farmland directly is extremely difficult without local knowledge and management, as well as large investment commitments. AcreTrader solves these issues by providing transparency, flexibility, and ease of use to people wanting to invest in farmland while handling all aspects of administration and property management, from insurance and accounting to working with local farmers and improving soil sustainability. At the same time, AcreTrader works to help farmers scale through innovative sales and leasing opportunities. See our How it Works page for more details.

JOB CODE: 1000026
node.title: Investment Analyst

node.description:
THE B-TEAM

We’re so glad you’re interested in joining our team. Here are some things you should know about any full-time position within our company:


Our Culture (aka expectations) - B-Unlimited team members should possess:

Strong Work Ethic - We get shirts done. We’re the largest capacity producer in the state of Arkansas, and we have unparalleled turnaround time and customer satisfaction. That’s because we all work hard, all the time. Well, except for when it’s play time!

Attention to Detail  - Every step of the printing process requires scrutinizing attention to detail. The smallest oversights result in really expensive corrections, so we need team members who aim to get it right the first time.

Strong Communication Skills - Unlike most printing companies, we house sales, art, production, and shipping all in one space. Every print job is a collaboration between all of these departments, and we use Slack, Pipedrive, walkie talkies, e-mail, text, and good old fashioned words to get things done. Clear, kind, and quick communication is a must.

Collaborative Propensity - Everything that we create is the product of collaboration. Teamwork is a must, and our team is built of people who are both dependable and adaptable, humble yet take pride in their work, and take initiative while being understanding.

 

The Business Development Manager (Custom Apparel Sales) position includes the following responsibilities: 

Build new territories with a primary focus on recruiting new customers

Identify sales leads and follow up with new business opportunities 

Building and maintaining successful relationships with prospects and existing customers

Meet with customers to create new design ideas and plan semester-long orders for events

Travel to meet with customers at other campuses

When traveling, set-up multiple face-to-face meetings over the course of a day with new and existing clients

Research large-scale potential clients and intentionally pursue those accounts

Meet with chapter presidents and t-shirt chairs planning seasonal events

Collaborate on business strategies 

Maximize business reach and potential
node.title: Sales Team - Business Development Manager (Collegiate Sales)

node.description:
At AcreTrader, we empower our customers to buy and sell land smarter with advanced technology, data, and expertise. To stay committed to our mission as a company, we need to continue to grow our UX Research team. AcreTrader is hiring a UX Researcher who will work directly with one of our business units. As the UX Researcher you'll play a key role in executing the generation and facilitation of user-led research studies. Additionally, you’ll collaborate with a multi-disciplinary group using a suite of analytics to assist you in determining what stories and features should be created and prioritized.

Core Responsibilities: 

  • Self-initiate and conduct research projects for your business unit to build deep foundational knowledge of users and the product
  • Conduct research consisting of hypothesis, foundational research, strategic testing, implementation, and monitoring
  • Develop a deep empathic understanding of your users, learn about their needs, and identify opportunities to delight them
  • Demonstrate your deep understanding of our users and personas by delivering two case studies per year
  • Show actionable insights in a clear and compelling way
  • Effectively prioritize your research efforts along with product goals; align with the team while considering impact, the goals of your research, the broader product vision, and company objectives
  • Guide Product Managers and Product Designers in conducting research with a high degree of value; ensure research follows your defined and documented processes
  • Demonstrate, explain, and teach others how to apply a range of research methods to extract both quantitative and qualitative data
  • Actively contribute to the UX Research team culture, processes, and documentation

Key Competencies

  • 2+ years in cognitive science, statistics, human psychology, computer science, computer interaction, or related field
  • 2+ years in qualitative and quantitative research methods
  • Proficient in streaming analytics (e.g. GTM, Google Analytics)
  • Proficiency in SQL
  • Proficiency in either Tableau or PowerBI
  • Exceptional communication skills to relay complex information simply and concisely to collaborating personnel including C-suite
  • A strong analytical and problem solving mindset
  • Passion and effectiveness in mentoring others through collaboration
  • Ability to self-motivate and self-manage, with strong organizational skills
  • Ability to conduct research in person and remote settings
  • Proficiency in analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Amplitude)
  • Experience working on enterprise and consumer facing products

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Startup experience
  • Experience in the fintech industry
  • Experience using Amplitude
  • Experience with VWO analytics suite

About AcreTrader Inc. and the AcreTrader Platform

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast-moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, get in touch.

AcreTrader is a real estate investing platform that makes it easy to buy shares of farmland and earn passive income. United States farmland has historically outperformed most asset classes and other forms of real estate. Unfortunately, buying and maintaining farmland directly is extremely difficult without local knowledge and management, as well as large investment commitments. AcreTrader solves these issues by providing transparency, flexibility, and ease of use to people wanting to invest in farmland while handling all aspects of administration and property management, from insurance and accounting to working with local farmers and improving soil sustainability. At the same time, AcreTrader works to help farmers scale through innovative sales and leasing opportunities. See our How it Works page for more details.

AcrePro, the brokerage arm of AcreTrader, provides best-in-class land valuation, sales, development, and conservation expertise to its customers. At the core of AcrePro is a highly qualified team, combining decades of experience in financial services and agriculture alongside millions of dollars in transactions. Our simple mission is to create a faster, more transparent way for buyers and sellers to transact in the world of farmland. AcrePro’s offerings include investing, land management, appraisal, auctions, diligence and evaluation, financing, land and resource conservation, and more.

AcreMaps aims to be the most comprehensive, accurate, and useful mapping tool for agriculture. There are over 50 million farmland owners in the world that require a better service to explore their land. That includes using satellite imagery to discover how land has evolved, pricing land at market values through valuation algorithms, and exploring many layers of underlying agronomic information. Our team solves complex computer science problems, designs beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improves the accuracy of our data to set the industry standard for mapping.

node.description:
AcreTrader is looking to hire a Customer Success Manager based in Fayetteville, AR to join the Acres team. This is an exciting opportunity to help scale the launch of our new geospatial mapping product within the AcreTrader business suite.As the leader of the Acres Customer Success team, you will be the forward-facing ambassador for the Acres product. You will not only be a vocal advocate for our users in order to create an enriching customer experience, but you will be the relationship builder and nurturer of our growing enterprise-level customer base. 

Initially, your primary responsibilities in this role will be to build scalable processes and procedures that will support an expansion of an outstanding CS team. From there you will help us to define, evolve, and execute internal and external support strategies to drive ongoing customer satisfaction as we grow quickly and intentionally. 

The CS Manager will work with internal and external stakeholders to ensure we are prioritizing our work in a way that accelerates the improvement of our product and empowers our users. The candidate should have a keen interest in the industry and be passionate about customer service. The person in this role will be an excellent communicator, both in writing and speaking. The success of this role will be measured by the execution of overall client satisfaction, business planning growth, and retention.

This role will be working within a startup environment that requires flexibility and nimbleness. As at any growing company, you can expect many other tasks and responsibilities to be assigned, as well as growth opportunities to be seized.

Core Responsibilities: 

  • Onboard and train additional customer success team members
  • Establish workflows and the metrics required to measure and improve overall customer satisfaction and retention
  • Be a product expert and educate customers on the product in a way that instills confidence and encourages adoption
  • Collaborate across functional teams – to optimize efficiency and resolution of user’s requests and other needs
  • Collect feedback from external users and share product blind spots with the Acres team in order to improve the product
  • Identify and act to remove obstacles to deliver consistently high levels of service
  • Develop a plan and manage enterprise account users to provide excellent customer service
  • Stay current on the latest industry trends and techniques by maintaining constant curiosity and a desire to learn

Key Competencies/Requirements: 

  • 2-3 years of experience in customer service and engagement role
  • 1-3 years experience in a process improvement role
  • Experience in Hubspot or CRM
  • Experience managing and coordinating highly functioning teams
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to thrive in a startup environment
  • Ability to think strategically and implement tactics that align with prescribed strategies 
  • Ability to handle multiple requests through efficient communication
  • High attention to detail & organization 

 Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working at a startup
  • Administrative Experience
  • Management Experience

About AcreTrader & Acres 

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and in order to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast-moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, read on.

Acres aims to be the most comprehensive, accurate, and useful mapping tool for agriculture. There are over 50 million farmland owners in the world that require a better service to explore their land. That includes using satellite imagery to discover how land has evolved, pricing land at market values through valuation algorithms, and exploring many layers of underlying agronomic information. Our team solves complex computer science problems, designs beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improves the accuracy of our data to set the industry standard for mapping.

node.description:
Position: Head of Development

Reports to: CEO

Team: Development

Status: Full-time

Position Overview

The Head of Development is responsible for leading and equipping the Development team to advance the mission and vision of Lifewater International to all new and existing donors. The Head of Development will oversee the Donor Relations and Marketing teams and provide strategic guidance in communicating the Lifewater story.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Provide leadership in all aspects of Lifewater development activities, including marketing and donor relations and planned giving
  • Build a culture of collaboration
  • Establish a comprehensive development plan and specific objectives for the organization and team members, setting both yearly and longer-term goals
  • Oversee the planning and implementation of a comprehensive marketing plan
  • Oversee the collection, distribution, and analysis of statistical data to drive performance
  • Coach team members to grow professionally and personally through their work and developmental opportunities
  • Assist team to identify, cultivate, solicit and steward planned giving opportunities
  • Work closely with the CEO and serve on the senior leadership team
  • Other duties as assigned

Work Experience and Qualifications

Required Qualifications

  • Adherence to Lifewater’s statement of faith
  • Passion for Lifewater’s mission of serving vulnerable communities and children
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
  • 10+ years of leadership experience, and experience hiring and developing a team
  • 8+ years’ experience in sales/fundraising and marketing efforts for an organization
  • 5+ years working in a non-profit setting, with a global focus
  • The ability to build a comprehensive strategic plan in line with the organization’s goals and efforts
  • Exceptional public speaking, written communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to travel internationally and/or domestically multiple times per year
  • Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship will be provided

Preferred Qualifications

  • Familiarity with project management software, such as Asana
  • Familiarity with Salesforce

Physical Qualifications

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at a time

Senior Manager - FP&A

AcreTrader is hiring a Senior Corporate Financial Analyst to be a core member of our Finance team. Through this role, you’ll work directly with our organization’s leadership to plan, analyze, and manage financial performance as we continue to scale and grow the organization. This is an exciting opportunity for a proactive financial professional that has an innate curiosity and passion for solving complex problems.

Core Responsibilities 

  • Build and manage financial models for AcreTrader’s business units and develop forecasts based on your intimate knowledge of our products and strategic initiatives.
  • Work with leaders across the organization to forecast cash flow needs and priorities.
  • Create managerial reporting to provide visibility into business performance.
  • Directly support CFO in special projects as needed.
  • Support strategic planning processes through analysis of industry trends and internal performance.
  • Participate in our board and investor reporting process.

Key Competencies 

  • 3+ years relevant experience in positions that require analysis, reporting financial results, forecasting, budgeting, and data interpretation of business impact and results
  • Experience working with multiple business units and combining information to a single statement
  • Proven ability to lead and drive complex projects and analyses
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability explain complex financial topics in simplistic terms
  • A creative mindset with innate curiosity to business models and industry trends
  • Experience communicating with senior leadership and the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Agriculture industry expertise a plus but not required

node.description:
Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) of Northwest Arkansas (NWA) is a nonprofit organization whose mission is to provide quality volunteer representation for abused and neglected children in the court system. Part of a national movement, CASA of NWA was founded locally in 1997 and serves foster children in Benton, Washington, Carroll, and Madison counties.


CASA of NWA is seeking a Development Coordinator to provide administrative support for our marketing and fundraising efforts. As an overview, this full-time position will assist with gift entry and acknowledgement, donor communications, marketing, donor stewardship, and event coordination. The Development Coordinator will report to the Director of Development & Marketing.

node.description:
AcreTrader, Inc. is hiring three Product Owners based in Northwest Arkansas to join the growing software development teams which support our AcreTrader, AcrePro, and AcreMaps platforms. These positions present the opportunity to help build and enhance some of our most important externally facing products. An ideal candidate will be comfortable ramping up quickly so that they can help prioritize and refine feature sets.

For each platform, the Product Owner will work with internal and external stakeholders to ensure we are delivering maximum value. They will be responsible for creating well-written, thorough user stories which our software development squads will leverage to deliver new features. Hiring the right people for these roles is important to our team because they will be integral to the creation and continuous improvement of our products. As at any growing company, you can expect many other tasks and responsibilities to be assigned as well as growth opportunities to be seized.

Core Responsibilities

  • Communicate regularly with internal and external stakeholders to optimize business value from our product(s)
  • Work closely with the Product Manager to ensure feature requirements are in line with product strategy
  • Utilize SAFe methodology to elicit requirements and prioritize features
  • Decompose epics and features into clearly written user stories which contain acceptance criteria
  • Participate in, and in some cases lead, Agile Scrum ceremonies
  • Create visual aids to demonstrate requirements to our development squads, e.g. process flows, mind maps, etc.
  • Work one on one with UX resources to ensure product vision is properly captured
  • Measure feature usage post-release to make recommendations to our business partners concerning enhancement, modification, or retirement of features

Key Competencies/Requirements

  • 2+ years experience working as a technical Product Owner in an Agile environment
  • 2+ years working in Agile project management tools like Azure Dev Ops, Jira, ZenHub, etc.
  • 2+ years interpreting streaming analytics, e.g. GA, Firebase, Data Studio, etc.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience in creating documentation which breaks down complex requirements into easier-to-understand features: (e.g. Visio, Miro, Lucid Charts, etc.)
  • Openness to learning and sharing knowledge
  • Local to Fayetteville Arkansas or willing to relocate 

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Undergraduate degree in product management, computer science, or related field
  • Startup experience
  • Experience in the fintech industry

Legal authorization to work in the United States is a precondition to employment at AcreTrader.

AcreTrader is seeking an Agent Support Specialist to join the AcrePro team. This role will be responsible for working with internal teams to quickly and effectively respond to the incoming needs of our ever-growing number of agents around the United States. The support of this role will help us to responsibly scale as we work to make buying and selling land common, transparent, and easy. Someone with a high level of urgency, customer service experience, and who enjoys creative problem solving will excel in this role. 

Core Responsibilities

  • Uphold positive customer experience with our agents
  • Receive, coordinate and delegate problems to appropriate team members through our ticketing system

  • As at any growing company, expect many other tasks and responsibilities to be assigned as well as growth opportunities to be seized

  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

node.description:
This is a key role as a primary point of contact for patients of Ivey Family Medicine. Ivey Family Medicine is a close knit fast-paced environment requiring a positive and adaptive nature. We are looking for an energetic person who loves patient care and is willing to learn new things.

Tasks/Accountabilities:

• Strong daily on-time attendance is critical.

• Greet patients both in person and on the phone to the clinic in a customer-oriented manner.

• Assist physician with the duties of that role.

• Room patients and take histories for entry into the EMR.

• Obtain prior authorizations.

• Give intramuscular and subcutaneous and intradermal injections.

• Obtain blood samples and do in-house lab tests.

• Ensure exam rooms are clean.

• Manage referral requirements accurately and in a timely manner.

• Effectively meet post exam process requirements.

• Take inventory of medical and exam room supplies.

• Additional compensation for phlebotomy skills and medical scribe experience.

Experience/Education:

• Certified from an accredited medical assistant program with current certification.

• Certified BLS

• Experience in using an EMR required.

• Minimum 1 year experience as a Medical Assistant in a medical clinic required.

• Working knowledge and medical terminology is required.

• Must be able to work well in a small team environment.

• Have an affinity and passion for excellence in healthcare.

• Knowledge of HIPAA.
node.title: Medical Assistant (MA)

node.description: As the Lead Graphic Designer for the department, this person will be responsible for the visual brand of the University of Arkansas Razorback Athletic Department across print, digital, and video platforms, and facilities. They will oversee the development of the visual identity for each of our 19 teams and oversee the assistant graphic designer position. Together, they will work in collaboration with the marketing and communications teams on execution of creative content including all marketing material, social media content, animation, and advertising creative. This role also serves as the lead designer for facility related design projects, working with the Print Shop Specialist on the execution of graphics for our facilities.

node.description: The Director of Ticket Operations will be responsible for building event infrastructure using the Paciolan system for assigned sports, and using that information to oversee ensuring ticket accuracy, and ticket distribution for each event. They will implement policies and procedures for the sale and distribution of season and individual game tickets. The Director will serve as primary ticket office liaison for assigned sports, mainly football, as liaison with customers as it relates to annual renewals, coordinate ticket allocation and oversee printing and distribution. They will also supervise the reconciliation of gate receipts from athletic events for assigned sports and analyze ticket data and use to prepare weekly attendance reports for all sales and attendance figures for assigned sports, using this data to provide sales and attendance trends, and how they relate to sales, pricing, and special marketing activities. The position will require travel with sports as needed to administer Away Game/Post Season ticketing. The Director will have oversight over all full-time employees and part-time employees that are in the ticket operations department of the Razorback Ticket Center.

node.description:
At AcreTrader, the Product Designer will play a key role as we transition and grow, working on projects large and small that have an enormous impact on our business. 

The ideal candidate will be a passionate and vocal advocate for the user at every stage. From the power-user to the new or prospective customer, this candidate will help to build a strong, foundational design culture. They believe no user should be forgotten when looking for solutions and have an eye for edge cases. The Product Designer will bring their love of learning to the process of iteration as a steppingstone toward a solution. They will thrive in the pursuit of the best possible product, never settling for "okay" and proactively soliciting feedback to nurture the iterative nature of the design. They will not get discouraged when their concepts are misunderstood by users but instead will learn from them with the realization that good ideas come from everywhere.

Core Responsibilities 

  • Solve complex problems and help to define the user experience, from initial ideas to production-ready designs
  • Take a project from end to end, delivering solutions in tangible formats such as sketches, prototypes, wireframes, and production-ready UI designs
  • Make use of user research and quantitative data to make informed decisions
  • Participate in and deliver on the day-to-day production of design and/or development solutions
  • Help to create, maintain, and improve our design system
  • Work with various teams and project owners across Marketing, Product, and Engineering

Key Competencies

  • 3+ years of experience as a UX/UI or Product Designer
  • Proficiency in UI tools such as Figma (preferably), Sketch, or XD
  • Experience with prototyping and hand-off tools like Figma, Zeplin and Invision
  • An understanding of design constraints on both Web and Mobile
  • Experience in researching and performing competitive analysis and staying aware of best UX practices and trends
  • Excellent written and verbal skills
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies
  • Strong design fundamentals demonstrated in a portfolio of work
  • Willingness to voice design opinions while also being an effective collaborator
  • Ability to communicate decisions and back them up with data and real-world examples and/or experiences
  • Ability to receive a problem, explore possible solutions, and present recommendations to stakeholders
  • Ability to self-start and manage time well; ability to handle many projects and take ownership of schedule and deadlines
  • Skill at building/maintaining relationships with Engineers and PMs with the ability to effectively communicate and work with technology partners to create the best possible products

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Experience with Figma
  • Familiarity with analytics tools (VWO, GA, Amplitude)
  • Experience with workshops
  • Experience designing mapping software

About AcreTrader & Acres

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and in order to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, read on.

Acres aims to be the most comprehensive, accurate, and useful mapping tool for agriculture. There are over 50 million farmland owners in the world that require a better service to explore their land. That includes using satellite imagery to discover how land has evolved, pricing land at market values through valuation algorithms, and exploring many layers of underlying agronomic information. Our team solves complex computer science problems, designs beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improves the accuracy of our data to set the industry standard for mapping. 

JOB CODE: 1000046
node.title: Product Designer

node.description:
AcreMaps is seeking a business intelligence (BI) analyst based in Northwest Arkansas to join the growing data science team that supports our AcreMaps platform. As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, you will combine business acumen, technology, and innovation to provide valuable insights for product decisions in AcreMaps. The BI Analyst will explore ways to leverage both internal data and user-provided information to improve AcreMaps data offerings, customizations, and client tracking. The BI Analyst will be part of the business intelligence team and work on metrics and analytics that ensure velocity in meeting AcreMaps’ goals of gaining and retaining users.

You will work with the business intelligence team to leverage data visualizations and warehousing expertise, manage project schedules, design and implement key performance indicators (KPI), and clearly communicate with project stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be comfortable ramping up quickly to analyze existing data and create meaningful user insights that better engage and retain users. The BI Analyst will work closely with the data science team lead, Senior UX Researchers, and Product Manager to create technical and automated approaches to user testing and analytics. The candidate will work with existing data and begin operationalizing user testing information to develop formal analysis of user personas. Hiring the right person for this role is important to our team because they will be an integral part of the creation and continuous improvement of our AcreMaps platform.

Core Responsibilities: 

  • Partner closely with Product and Marketing teams, understand their data needs, and build plans to address those with intelligent data solutions in a timely and sustainable fashion.
  • Deliver data solutions that tell a story and provide insights to the users, enabling them to make better decisions, and more efficiently complete their responsibilities.
  • Incorporate best practices for reporting, dashboards and scorecards, and data visualization for key performance indicators.
  • Maintain highest levels of development practices (i.e., technical design, solution development, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution, writing clean, modular, and self-sustaining code).

Key Competencies/Requirements: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in programming (Python, R) and SQL/Postgres.
  • Data visualization expertise with tools like Tableau, MS Excel, HubSpot, etc.
  • Experience with building data infrastructure (e.g., designing architecture, building data pipelines, implementing scalable monitoring) and implementing automated reporting solutions.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to thrive in startup environment
  • Legal authorization to work in the United States is a precondition to employment at AcreTrader

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Master's degree in a quantitative discipline with 2+ years of work experience
  • Experience working on teams that managed large-scale data projects.
  • Conceptual, logical and physical data modeling, and data architecture knowledge.
  • Transparency and openness to feedback
  • Comfort working in an Agile environment
  • Jira or similar sprint-oriented project workflow software

About Acretrader 

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and in order to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, read on.

AcreMaps

AcreMaps aims to be the most comprehensive, accurate, and useful mapping tool for agriculture. There are over 50 million farmland owners in the world that require a better service to explore their land. That includes using satellite imagery to discover how land has evolved, pricing land at market values through valuation algorithms, and exploring many layers of underlying agronomic information. Our team solves complex computer science problems, designs beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improves the accuracy of our data to set the industry standard for mapping.

node.description:
SVI creates world-class training products, systems and services for leading companies across a variety of industries. We are passionate about great design and believe in its power to change people’s behaviors. To create unique, engaging experiences, our training materials and presentations must be exciting and beautiful while reflecting the look and feel of our clients’ brands and cultures. Our training systems and apps must also have intuitive, fun interfaces to make deploying training fast. That’s where you come in.

We are looking for our next senior graphic designer to push our company and industry forward. The ideal candidate has a passion for visual design; and is talented at problem-solving in a fast-paced, creative environment. While this role is currently a one-person show for our company, there is the opportunity to do it all – print layout, presentation design, UX for systems, and video production!

The ideal candidate has:

  • A passion for design and hunger to stay engaged with trends in design and technology
  • Great functional skills to execute on projects and dig in to get the job done with a meticulous eye for detail and efficiency
  • Ability to communicate ideas clearly internally to the team and to our clients
  • Problem-solving skills to bring creative solutions to projects
  • Ability to manage multiple large, dynamic projects with agility to meet the needs of our clients
  • A service mindset always wanting to bring the best work to our clients
  • A strong work ethic willing to go the extra mile to create outstanding work
  • A fun personality that thrives in a creative environment

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Creative media design (eLearning, motion graphics, video, and print) for SVI clients.
  • Implement best practices for design, as well as usability principles and techniques
  • Interact and collaborate directly with corporate clients, creative contractors, and SVI’s instructional design team
  • Develop compelling and creative visual themes & concepts that support learning/training content
  • Design eLearning, and motion graphic production layouts and assets
  • Design supporting visual assets for SVI’s LMS app Learner Mobile
  • Integrate visuals within development tools such as Power Point, Articulate Storyline, Rise, and Vyond.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree in design or related field
  • 3+ years of professional experience in a fast-paced, deadline-driven creative environment
  • Advanced skill level in the latest versions of Adobe Creative Suite/Creative Cloud with an emphasis in Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
  • Experience with branding and web design
  • Experience with systems UX design preferred
  • Strong illustration and icon design skills
  • Experience with Adobe After Effects and Premiere a plus

Requirements for consideration:

  • Portfolio showcasing experience with interactive design, illustration, and print design. Any eLearning examples are a plus.

node.description:
AcreMaps is looking for a Data Science Developer to join and help build the growing data science team that supports our AcreTrader platform. The Data Science Developer will work with data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and software engineers to create innovative and impactful data products for AcreMaps. This role will implement cutting-edge machine learning methods with expansive datasets to discover, generate, validate, and integrate actionable land information into scalable solutions for AcreMaps.

The ideal candidate will be able write elegant Python code for varied data science projects. The person in this role will continuously develop new skills and learn new technologies to adapt to changing trends and frameworks. In addition, the candidate will be a keen problem solver, passionate about Big Data technologies, analytics, and data science. The candidate will be comfortable ramping up quickly to build real-world, scalable machine learning pipelines for both prototyping and deploying new products in AcreMaps. Hiring the right person for this role is important to our team because they will be an integral part of the creation and continuous improvement of our AcreMaps platform.

Core Responsibilities: 

  • Communicate and collaborate with the data science team and internal stakeholders
  • Develop, validate, and scale machine learning pipelines for the AcreMaps team
  • Work at the interface of data science and software engineering to deliver analysis at scale
  • Write efficient, maintainable code for prototyping and deployment
  • Develop cutting-edge algorithms to leverage our data into valuable insights
  • Contribute to planning, analysis, workflow processing, and ideation of future data products
  • Play a key role in product development and team meetings

Key Competencies/Requirements: 

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, data analytics, engineering, or related field
  • 3+ years experience with Python
  • Experience with PostgreSQL/PostGIS
  • Experience with Git
  • Knowledge of statistics and machine learning 
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform or similar cloud computing platforms
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to thrive in a startup environment
  • Transparency and openness to feedback
  • Legal authorization to work in the United States is a precondition to employment at AcreTrader

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Graduate degree in a relevant field
  • Experience with Google Earth Engine
  • Experience with geospatial and imagery data
  • Experience with Docker
  • Experience with Kubernetes
  • Comfort working an Agile environment

About AcreTrader

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. There are over 50 million farmland owners in the world that require a better service to explore their land. That includes using satellite imagery to discover how land has evolved, pricing land at market values through valuation algorithms, and exploring many layers of underlying agronomic information. Our team solves complex computer science problems, designs beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improves the accuracy of our data to set the industry standard for mapping.

node.description:
At The SOAR Afterschool Program, we believe every child has the capacity to be a leader. SOAR partners with hardworking families in NWA to ensure that elementary students have the critical supports and opportunities they need to develop their full potential. Surrounded by the most passionate staff around, SOAR students are celebrated and embraced for who they are today and what we know they’ll accomplish tomorrow. SOAR provides enrichment activities in academics, a focus on public speaking and leadership skills and a fun and safe atmosphere to belong in. SOAR staff hours are 2:15-6:15, Monday-Friday in Rogers and 2:30-6:30 in Springdale, with the option to choose days. Visit our website at soarafterschool.com

The SOAR Program Leader reports directly to the SOAR Site Director and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Coordinate SOAR Program during the school year
  • Helping develop and implement programming for SOAR
  • Oversight of student academic progress and seeking to motivate their growth
  • Participation in program evaluation
  • Attending special event programming
  • Document all programming goals and objectives as requested by the SOAR Director
  • Assisting with all areas of programming with an emphasis on creativity and program enhancement
  • Helping document all attendance, discipline issues, incident, and accident reports
  • Directly oversee up to 25 students in a group
  • Other supervisory responsibilities for students throughout the day included
  • Holding all staff accountable to policy enforcement and assisting SOAR in abuse prevention
  • Building relationships with SOAR Students and their families
  • Support & assist in the SOAR House System
  • Responsible to SOAR Directors and Site Directors
  • Complete all DHS/Grant Responsibilities as assigned by SOAR Director and Site Directors

node.description:
TheatreSquared seeks a Marketing & Development Manager to join the organization’s team while working to develop a larger and more inclusive audience in its brand-new, state-of-the art, $31 million home. Under the leadership of the Director of Marketing & Communications and the Director of Development, this team member will support the theatre’s earned and contributed revenue initiatives by leading holistic campaigns and programs to earn and grow loyalty among new audiences and core patrons, resulting in increased ticket buying and giving.

By expanding the theatre’s audience with a commitment to inclusion and access—and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this new staff member will help TheatreSquared to answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Work closely with the Directors of Marketing and Development and teammates to prioritize the holistic patron experience across campaigns that align with T2’s mission and brand.
  • Implement data-informed strategies to attract new-to-file patrons (NTF), craft compelling invitations and offers to reduce the churn of new-to-file (NTF) households and retain & upgrade relationships with current ticket buyers and donors.
  • Assist in planning for a more purposeful group sales effort going into next season, including prospecting, offer-modeling, networking, and strategic relationship building.
  • Manage the yearly marketing and annual fund patron communications calendar.
  • Assist in executing digital marketing & fundraising campaigns, including but not limited to: email, social media, SEO/SEM, and display advertising.
  • Develop marketing and fundraising initiatives to enhance and grow the company's audience in Northwest Arkansas and online.
  • Create weekly reports and analysis for direct mail, ad placements, and email blasts.
  • Collaborate with the Director of Marketing to conduct research and analysis projects to drive cross-departmental strategies.  
  • Work with the development team to create segments for appeals and prioritize messaging to patrons according to their patron lifecycle stage.
  • Assist with writing fundraising appeals, stewardship materials, and marketing sales copy.
  • Maintain industry-leading knowledge of patron experience, and stay abreast of industry trends.
  • Exemplify the TheatreSquared core values with others to advance the organization’s mission.

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Associate or bachelor's degree in marketing, graphic design, sales, English/creative writing/communications, or a related field with a minimum of two years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work well with a wide range of people.
  • Highly organized and proactive, with the ability to take initiative, manage multiple tasks and projects at a time, and deliver within deadlines.
  • Must be goal-oriented, self-motivated, highly flexible, and able to accept feedback..

DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro), Canva, Microsoft Office Suite, and Google Suite.
  • Demonstrable graphic design skills with a portfolio provided (Work samples encouraged). 
  • Experience with digital communication software. Prospect2 and Donate2 experience a plus.
  • Proficient in Tessitura or other ticketing or donor software. If not yet proficient, being a self-starter to learn with the help of online tutorials.
  • Experience working on copy generation. (Work samples encouraged)

TO APPLY 

To apply, submit a cover letter, employment resume, and references by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/. 

TheatreSquared celebrates diversity and commits to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our goal is to remove barriers to employment that are faced by racialized groups and encourage applicants of all genders, abilities, and ethnic, socio-economic, religious, and educational backgrounds. TheatreSquared believes that a team with a variety of perspectives 

and skills are critical to our growth as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. 

Please note: All interviews at this time will be held via video service (Google, Zoom, etc.) 

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

This permanent, full-time, exempt position includes an annual salary in the range of $45,000-55,000, commensurate with experience. Full-time benefits include health; dental; paid time off; relocation assistance; paid parental leave; professional development allowance; employer-sponsored long-term and short-term disability; $100,000 in employer-sponsored term life insurance; and voluntary 401(k). Relocation assistance is also available.

THEATRESQUARED MISSION

We believe that theatre—done well and with passion—can transform lives and communities. At the theatre, in schools and online, we create remarkable performances; broaden access; foster empathy, equity and cohesion; and gather with one another around art, conversation, food and other shared experiences in a welcoming, inclusive space.

ABOUT THEATRESQUARED & NORTHWEST ARKANSAS 

Now in its 16th season, TheatreSquared’s challenging, heartfelt, and intimate productions reach 60,000 patrons each year, including more than 20,000 students and their teachers. T2 fills a crucial niche in the region’s cultural landscape as the only year-round, producing professional theatre within a 150-mile radius, operating on an annual budget of $6 million. TheatreSquared employs trained artists from across the country to create its 330 annual performances and is contracted with Actors' Equity Association. The theatre is also Arkansas’s home for professional playwrights, developing scripts through the Arkansas New Play Festival in Fayetteville and Bentonville and producing new works and world premieres each year. TheatreSquared’s architecturally significant, 50,000-square-foot, two-venue permanent home was completed in 2019. For details on the facility, visit ournextstage.org. 

Fayetteville and Northwest Arkansas were ranked 8th by US News and World Report in its 2021 "Best Places to Live in the US.” Located in the scenic Ozarks and offering a low cost of living and high quality of life, this vibrant metro area recently surpassed the half-million population mark and is home to the headquarters of Fortune 100 companies including Walmart Stores, J.B. Hunt, Tyson, and peer world-class cultural institutions such as Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art.
node.title: Marketing and Development Manager

Job Title: Retail Manager

Job Purpose: Orchestrate the Buddy Pegs retail experience to make sure customers get the products they need to make their family riding experience as good as it can be.

About Buddy Pegs

Buddy Pegs is looking for change-makers who want to help build confident kids and connected families through the power of the bicycle.

Key Performance Areas

  • Achieve sales goals.
  • Hire, train, and manage a team of A-Player sales associates and mechanics.
  • Manage inventory levels to plan
  • Maintain a clean and organized shop.
  • Manage all logistics for our rental program.
  • Take the field as a Coach from time to time.

More on inventory management: Maintaining a dedicated focus on our physical inventory is critical and goes beyond simply re-ordering items.

  • Weekly inventory cycle counts, analysis of sales & obsolete inventory, etc.
  • Updating & adding inventory and PO's to our point of sale system (Lightspeed).
  • Shipping & receiving orders.
  • Warranty processing.
  • Merchandising.
  • Marketing - work with Marketing Director to feature and promote certain products.

Skills

  • Sales through genuine communication
  • Motivate and encourage a team
  • Spreadsheet proficiency
  • Modern digital platform / technology proficiency (able to use a variety of apps and software)
  • Basic mechanical aptitude

Behaviors & Other Qualities

  • Excellent communicator in written and verbal form
  • Dedicated to efficient productivity
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong attention to follow through; sees things through to the finish line
  • Proficient at riding a bicycle
  • Inherent "kid magic"
  • Able to lift 35 lbs

Experience - Qualified candidates will have 3+ years of experience in:

  • Building and managing teams
  • Managing a retail store (or equivalent experience)
  • What’s important is that you want to help kids develop life skills and enduring happiness. What’s not important is that you are a high-level bicyclist.

Available Job Resources

  • Access to Buddy Pegs playbook of systems and processes
  • Daily support of the Buddy Pegs Leadership team

Deal Killers

  • Poor attention to detail
  • Poor responsiveness
  • Lack of independent decision-making ability
  • Introverted
  • Easily flustered when things don't go as planned / lack of ability to adjust on the fly
  • Uncomfortable around children
  • Uncomfortable with digital tools
  • Uncomfortable with spreadsheets
  • Not available on weekends
  • No relative experience

Decision-Making Authority Levels

  • Retail ordering and pricing in line with our business plan
  • Retail and service department hiring and firing
  • Managing HQ related expenses within budget

Reporting to

  • Scott Fitzgerald, Owner

Pay-check and Beyond

  • This is a salaried position ranging from $45-50K per year based on qualifications
  • Simple IRA with 3% match
  • Health Care reimbursement plan
  • Encouraged time to ride your bike (routine meetings on bikes)
  • 2 hours per month of paid volunteer time
  • Access to bikes and parts at cost!

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Health insurance
  • Retirement plan

Experience level:

  • 3 years

Weekly day range:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Bentonville, AR 72712: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Application Question(s):

  • What defines a successful manager in your eyes?
  • What does the bicycle mean to you?
  • What experience with children do you have?
  • Have you ever had a job that was goal oriented? How do you feel about being being given a goal to achieve versus a list of tasks to be accomplished?
  • What type of manager and/or job environment do you need to bring out your best?
  • What can you tell us that gives us a sense of how organized you are as a person?
  • How will this job help you achieve your personal goals?

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

  • Team management: 3 years (Required)
  • Retail Store Managers: 3 years (Required)
  • Bicycle knowledge: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: One location

node.description:
Who are we: 

We are a small, but fast-growing supply chain consultancy. We are dedicated to creating long term collaborative partnerships, known as ‘upstreaming’ that remove cost from the supply chain and create shared value. Our operational expertise, ‘no win no fee’ contracts, and long-term approach differentiate us from other consulting firms – we feel a lot more like a partner to our clients than a consultancy. 

We draw from our wide-reaching flexible network to bring together the right experience and skillsets needed to succeed in each partnership; from reviewing opportunities in the supply chain, to finding the right partner, enabling clean room negotiations, contract signature, right through to ongoing management of the partnerships with governance and longer-term strategic cost reduction. 

  • We are a great place to work, with limited hierarchy and bureaucracy & huge opportunities to learn & grow. 
  • Our people are team focused and respectable with good personable soft skills (& a sense of humor!) 
  • Our people have self awareness, adaptability, and motivation to learn. 
  • We work with transparency and integrity. 
  • We care about our people and develop them – our people have the relevant skills, experience & relationships. 

What you will be doing: 

Data management and Analysis (60%) 

  • Produce business reporting and dashboards to help colleagues & client monitor, control & make decisions. 
  • Optimise reporting functionality and platforms (Power query, Retail link, Euromonitor, SQL) by working back from the business problem. 
  • Drive automation of data sources and intake processes. 
  • Building Burnsall’s infrastructure to store data in a logical and accessible way. 
  • Recommend solutions and come up with actionable insights based on the data. 
  • Be able to clearly communicate results & recommendations to colleagues and to our client.  
  • Own relationships externally and provide data support required to progress decision making. 

Research and Exploration (20%) 

  • Provide detailed research into new product categories and industries.  
  • Web-based company research to identify potential partners, determining key KPI criteria.  
  • Support build of business cases upon identification of new Upstreaming partnership. 

Continuous improvement projects with our vendor partners (20%) 

  • Analyze data from multiple sources to evaluate value adding opportunities across existing and new partnerships. 
  • Visit potential partners and identify opportunities for manufacturing efficiencies. 
  • Support colleagues & client in the analysis & delivery of continuous improvement projects.  

Skills, knowledge & experience desired: 

  • Knowledge & interest in improving retail supply chains across various consumer packed goods (CPG). 
  • At least 2 years background in BI, data analytics, consulting, e-commerce, or a related field.  
  • An understanding of the end-to-end implementation of Business Intelligence (BI) projects, especially in scorecards, KPIs, reports & dashboards. 
  • Experience with MS Excel, Power Pivot, Power BI, SQL, Retail link. Experience with VBA & Macros is a plus. 
  • Knowledge and understanding of key performance indicators related to Finance, supply chain & manufacturing. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - ability to identify patterns in data and discover insights.  
  • Strong attention to detail – accuracy of reports is a hygiene factor in trust relationship. 
  • Proven ability to work with ambiguity – We are a small business that is always changing. You should be willing and able to engage & contribute to projects outside the primary scope. 
  • Accountable – proactively & independently manage expectations of our client in a timely manner. 
  • Eager to learn, curious, optimistic & humble. 

Other requirements: 

  • Able to work in the U.S.  
  • Self motivated under a remote work style  
  • Personable – strong relationship management skills internally and externally (we want to have fun!) 

What will you get: 

  • Highly flexible working environment – home based with regular in person team connects at shared office space. 
  • A highly competitive package, including 29 days holiday plus public holidays. 
  • A high trust and enjoyable working environment. 
  • Travel. 
  • A social calendar with multiple annual events.

node.description:
Position: Marketing Project Manager

Reports to: Director of Marketing

Team: Development

Location: Office in Bentonville, AR

Status: Full time

Join our Team in the heart of Northwest Arkansas! Lifewater is an established Christian non-profit and community development organization walking with the rural poor to provide access to safe water, and improved sanitation and hygiene, one village at a time. For 45 years, we have served more than 2.5 million people in 40+ countries with life-saving clean water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) practices. Lifewater currently serves in Cambodia, Ethiopia, Tanzania, and Uganda.

Position Overview

The Marketing Project Manager is responsible for providing the day-to-day technical operations for the Marketing team. The role is accountable for capturing and analyzing data for the Development team, and for managing all operational aspects of the Lifewater website. The role will also report on data from Salesforce, and be a liaison for all marketing projects.

The Marketing Project Manager’s primary responsibilities include:

Project Management

  • Liaison between marketing and donor relations teams for all project management coordination, communication, and updates.
  • Ensure all project details and tasks are on track throughout the project, via frequent communication and team check-in.
  • Manage multiple projects related to marketing, including but not limited to, developing videos, compelling stories, and print-related material.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Insight Analysis and Learning

  • Work closely with the Director of Marketing to capture, monitor, and analyze results of all marketing efforts and make recommendations on how to improve results.
  • Work closely with the Technology department, Director of Marketing, and Chief Development Officer in developing automated, department-specific dashboards for marketing and donor relations. 
  • Create, generate, and interpret data for accurate, actionable reporting on marketing initiatives from the Salesforce database and Google Analytics.
  • Work closely with the Technology department to ensure all Development-related Salesforce tasks and reports are completed.
  • Responsible for all marketing dashboards and reporting metrics, used to track KPIs.

Website Management

  • Make necessary edits to the website regarding seasonal campaigns, and update the website content on a regular basis. 
  • Implement dynamic, relevant, and targeted landing pages and donation pages.
  • Communicate digital marketing updates with the organization, specifically the Development Team.
  • Conduct usability testing to identify opportunities and test new iterations on the website.

Work Experience and Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Adherence to Lifewater’s statement of faith
  • Passion for Lifewater’s mission of serving vulnerable communities and children
  • 3-5 years of related marketing experience
  • Experience managing and analyzing full-funnel Marketing data and KPIs
  • Experience using CRM databases, such as Salesforce
  • Experience using WordPress, with an understanding of its programming
  • Focused attention to detail, excellent organizational and project management skills, and the agile ability to multitask and work well under pressure
  • Ability to analyze data and to provide strategic insights with actionable recommendations in a concise and persuasive manner to marketing team members, cross-functional business partners and executive leadership.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skill
  • Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship will be provided

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in Marketing, Communication, Business, or a related field
  • Previous work experience with a non-profit organization
  • Experience working with Project Management systems, such as Asana

Physical Qualifications:

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at times

node.description:
Our Client Manager is a jack of all trades leader for their clients business. They help drive conversation from the boardroom to the warehouse. It is their job to help their clients make decisions that will strengthen their business in the long term and lead the charge on implementing those strategies across the world’s largest retailers.

Responsibilities of this role include:

  • Manage and lead strategy for your clients
  • Develop strong relationships with key retailers and client contacts
  • Lead clients and team in developing and maintaining an optimized e-commerce presence
  • Gather accurate and timely knowledge of ecommerce tends, data needs, and strategic pivots
  • Maintain pulse of retail trends
  • Grow your clients business

To Thrive in this Role ::

  • Expertise in Amazon OR Walmart platforms: Vendor & Seller Central, Walmart Retail Link & Supplier Center
  • Experience working with Amazon and Walmart ecommerce or other top retailor platforms
  • Enjoy working with a team
  • Excellent written communicator
  • Attentive to detail and accuracy
  • Strength to speak with candor
  • Entrepreneurial spirit – the desire to learn quickly and learn continually
  • Ability to react on your feet and pivot with moment’s notice
  • Ownership & confidence in leading your clients and team
  • Strong self-awareness and relentlessly high standards
  • Understand the practice of curiosity without compromising your priorities
  • Unwavering obsession to maintain and gain knowledge in the ecommerce retail industry and use this to grow our client’s business.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Storytelling & Presentation Creation
  • Ease in working pivot tables, v-look ups, percent difference formulas and manipulating data to tell a story and gain insights
  • Exudes the attributes : hungry, humble and smart
  • Exudes our core values : transparency, relationship, ownership and team work

node.description:
We are looking for a well-rounded, meticulous, and analytical Finance professional to play a key role in managing the financial activities of our organization. WhyteSpyder is a fast-paced company in a high-growth environment and one of Ascential PLC’s dynamic Digital Commerce brands. This position will report into the Digital Commerce finance organization and will act as the key business partner to the CEO of WhyteSpyder. Key responsibility of this role will be to enhance and build the budgeting, analysis, and reporting functions of WhyteSpyder and will lead on the migration of WhyteSpyder finance systems onto SAP. This role will be dedicated to helping WhyteSpyder and its stakeholders make well-informed decisions based on company financial analysis and performance.

Why consider WhyteSpyder:

  • Work in a high-energy environment with a vibrant culture and talented team
  • WhyteSpyder maintains an excellent balance by having a start-up mindset and culture, while being owned by Ascential, plc, a highly stable public UK company
  • Help shape the financial strategy for a world-class eCommerce company
  • Great learning and development opportunities
  • Direct line of communication to WhyteSpyder leadership on a daily basis
  • A benefits program, which includes medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, unlimited PTO, Flex Plan, Bonus Plan, matching 401k program and 14 days paid holidays per year

About you and what type of skills you'll need:

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in finance, e-commerce, mass retail and/or media industry
  • BA/BS in Finance, Accounting, or a quantitative field
  • Strong skills in using excel and large data sets to compose clear reports and aid decision making
  • Experience in general ledger, sub ledgers (AR / AP), reconciliations and month-end/year end close process
  • High level of attention to detail and possess the tenacity and determination to solve problems
  • Highly analytic and intuitive fast learner with ability to understand underlying data sets and turn them into insightful information and accurate forecasts
  • Adaptable, calm, and effective when responding to numerous time-sensitive, ad-hoc requests
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven track-record of building strong internal and external relationships
  • Exceptional communication skills and professional presence
  • Located in, or willing to relocate to, NW Arkansas

Nice to Have Skills:

  • CPA/MBA preferred but not required
  • QuickBooks, Hyperion, and SAP skills all a plus
  • Experience in finance systems migration / implementation
  • The ability to present ideas with conviction
  • Technological savvy and the ability to quickly learn and demonstrate new technology

What You’ll Do:

  • Financial Planning/Reporting:
  • WhyteSpyder
  • Provide effective partnership as the key point of contact for financial forecasting, analysis and financial impact of business activities across WhyteSpyder
  • Accurately track WhyteSpyder financial performance to budget/forecast
  • Advise EVP of Sales and CEO on business decisions from a financial perspective
  • Ascential
  • Act as the liaison to financial leaders across Ascential Digital Commerce
  • Lead the monthly forecasting and annual WhyteSpyder business planning process including monthly and annual reporting packages for senior leadership within WhyteSpyder and Ascential plc
  • Oversee financial reconciliations managed by Ascential
  • SAP Integration:
  • Act as primary stakeholder for new financial system development and integrations and act as advocate for WhyteSpyder to ensure business goals are met
  • Work with SAP migration team to collate and cleanse data in preparation for migration
  • Work with central finance function to facilitate the smooth transition of shared service functions to central team, and ongoing liaison to ensure accuracy and review reconciliations
  • Month end close / year end close / audit - work with central finance team to resolve any queries to enable their timely closing of ledgers
  • Client Billing and AR oversight:
  • Ensure proper onboarding of clients by central finance team from a billing perspective
  • Audit billing and help reconcile any inconsistencies
  • Oversee and ensure accuracy of cash allocation by central finance team
  • Review and evolve WhyteSpyder billing structure and processes with a view to eventual SAP migration

Location:

  • While WhyteSpyder features a flexible working environment, this role is expected to be predominantly in-person in the Rogers, AR WhyteSpyder office

Compensation Range:

  • Competitive Market Rate

node.description:
Position: Accounting Manager

Reporting to: Controller

Location: Bentonville, Arkansas

Art and Wellness Enterprises (AWE) is seeking a skilled, highly motivated, and entrepreneurial individual to join the team as an Accounting Manager. AWE supports operating non-profits founded by Alice Walton including the Alice L. Walton Foundation, Alice L. Walton School of Medicine, Art Bridges, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art, the Momentary, and Whole Health Institute.

About the Position:

The Accounting Manager will report to the Controller and be primarily responsible for supporting reconciliation reviews and financial control processes related to month-end close and reporting.

What you will do:

Key Roles & Responsibilities

  • Prepare and review appropriate ledger entries and reconciliations. Support with Month/Quarter/Year End closing tasks and assist in preparation of financial statements and related schedules
  • Develop and ensure all accounting activities and reporting of financial information follow established processes and procedures, and in compliance with GAAP standards
  • Completion of monthly financial binders for review
  • Development of process documentation
  • Establish and enforce proper accounting methods, policies and principles
  • Review reconciliations between the various systems which support the general ledger
  • Monthly other periodic balance sheet account reconciliations
  • Assist in preparation and review of monthly financial reports
  • Assist in preparation of board meeting packets
  • Assist Controller with assignment and completion of auditors PBC requests
  • Assist with gathering field work information
  • Bring an understanding of US GAAP and financial statement reporting best practices to the ecosystem
  • Coordinate with other staff to provide support for other finance and accounting projects
  • Track business activities and supporting information
  • Perform other duties as required and necessary to accomplish goals and objectives
  • Train and supervise accounting staff. Current staff is one accountant

Qualifications required for your success:

The individual will have energy, intellectual capacity, strategic business acumen and professional integrity. The ideal background will include:

  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance or related field
  • 5-10 years’ work experience in an accounting role within a professional setting
  • CPA certification is required
  • Working knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)
  • Advanced understanding of Microsoft Office, including Word and Excel
  • Superb professionalism and diplomacy; ability to interact with high-level individuals internally and externally
  • Workday or Financial Edge experience a plus

Personal attributes that support your success

  • Ability to act as a trusted advisor to principals and colleagues while demonstrating expertise and integrity
  • You are helpful, a team player, and show respect while collaborating with others
  • You are results oriented and exercise sound judgment in your work
  • A lifelong learner, who is inquisitive and solves problems with bold thinking and innovation
  • A visionary who plans for the future with imagination and wisdom
  • You are dedicated to achieving excellence and work with others to tackle the tasks at hand

All offers of employment are contingent on your successful completion (where permitted by state law) of a confidentiality agreement, background check, credit check and drug screen. AWE requires all employees to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment, or meet Arkansas state requirements, subject to accommodations. In addition, you will need to provide proper identification verifying your eligibility to work in the United States on your first day of work.

  • AWE is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building and maintaining a culturally diverse workplace. We encourage women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status of protected veteran, among other things or status as a qualified individual with a disability.
