node.description:
*Relocation assistance available*

TheatreSquared seeks a Human Resources Director to help actively create a culture of respect, collaboration, balance and empathy in a diverse, creative workforce. This key staff member will help the company to answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change and foster a community that is fundamentally inclusive and equitable?”

The HR Director will partner and collaborate with employees at every level of the organization and help to recruit and retain high-performing personnel. Reporting to the General Manager, this team member will also serve to support the broader financial and administrative operations of the theatre.  

The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated and collaborative coach, with a strong working knowledge of human resource practices, interpersonal skills, and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects concurrently.

The Human Resources Director will:

  • Lead human resources functions and collaborate with Director of Operations on finance functions including payroll, employee benefit plans, workers’ compensation, personnel recordkeeping, and other areas of administration with a focus on personnel.
  • Lead and collaborate closely with the General Manager to support recruiting activities, including creating/editing job descriptions, publicizing opportunities, screening, and hiring for open positions at both non-exempt and exempt level. Effectively track and measure training, development and retention of new hires. Plan orientation and onboarding of new hires, and support professional development activities for existing staff. Conduct exit interviews and implement retention actions if needed.
  • Identify legal requirements and government reporting regulations affecting human resources functions, ensuring policies, procedures, and reporting are in compliance. Research, create and recommend organizational human resource policies and procedures, maintain and distribute up-to-date employee handbook. Provide operational and consultative support to managers, including providing them with the tools and techniques to enable them to coach staff.
  • Work closely with the General Manager to continue to develop and implement TheatreSquared’s Inclusion, Diversity, Equity & Anti-Racism vision, with support from outside experts and the theatre’s staff-led Diversity Champions
  • Work closely with the Director of Education to recruit, publicize, screen, and hire for TheatreSquared’s Apprentice Program.
  • Support company morale and cohesion by participating in the planning of company events, retreats, shared messaging, and social opportunities.

QUALIFICATIONS

Candidates must have a working background and training in human resources. 

Interest or experience with work related to the company’s non-profit mission, including creating exceptional theatre, will be weighed positively. 

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

Compensation is highly competitive and commensurate with experience. 

This permanent, full-time, exempt position includes a competitive salary and full benefits. These benefits include health; dental; paid time off; paid parental leave; professional development allowance; employer-sponsored long-term and short-term disability; $100,000 in employer-sponsored term life insurance; and voluntary 401(k).

TO APPLY

To apply, submit an employment resume, references, cover letter and schedule availability by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/. 

TheatreSquared celebrates diversity and commits to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our goal is to remove barriers to employment that are faced by racialized groups and encourage applicants of all genders, abilities, and ethnic, socio-economic, religious, and educational backgrounds. TheatreSquared believes that a team with a variety of perspectives and skills is critical to our growth as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. 

THEATRESQUARED MISSION

We believe that theatre—done well and with passion—can transform lives and communities. At the theatre, in schools and online, we create remarkable performances; broaden access; foster empathy, equity and cohesion; and gather with one another around art, conversation, food and other shared experiences in a welcoming, inclusive space.

ABOUT THEATRESQUARED & NORTHWEST ARKANSAS 

Now entering its 17th season, TheatreSquared’s challenging, heartfelt, and intimate productions reach 60,000 patrons each year, including more than 20,000 students and their teachers. T2 fills a crucial niche in the region’s cultural landscape as the only year-round, producing professional theatre within a 150-mile radius, operating on an annual budget of $6 million. TheatreSquared employs trained artists from across the country to create its 330 annual performances and is contracted with Actors' Equity Association. The theatre is also Arkansas’s home for professional playwrights, developing scripts through the Arkansas New Play Festival in Fayetteville and Bentonville and producing new works and world premieres each year. TheatreSquared’s architecturally significant, 50,000-square-foot, two-venue permanent home was completed in 2019. For details on the facility, visit ournextstage.org. 

Fayetteville and Northwest Arkansas were ranked 8th by US News and World Report in its 2021 "Best Places to Live in the US.” Located in the scenic Ozarks and offering a low cost of living and high quality of life, this vibrant metro area recently surpassed the half-million population mark and is home to the headquarters of Fortune 100 companies including Walmart Stores, J.B. Hunt, Tyson, and peer world-class cultural institutions such as Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art.
node.title: Human Resources Director

node.description:
TheatreSquared is seeking teaching artists for 2022. Teaching artists will oversee the planning and instruction of classes/camps for students aged junior high to adult (18+) in a range of theatre techniques and skills set. We are currently hiring for Spring 2022 and Summer 2022 specifically, but will also consider teaching artists for the 2022-23 season. The theatre welcomes applicants of all backgrounds, and candidates who are Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) are strongly encouraged to apply.

As an enthusiastic, early-career theatre professional—and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this new staff member will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

DETAILS ON CLASSES AND CAMPS

Spring Classes for Youth (Grades 7-10)

  • Once a week for six weeks
  • February 7 - March 14, 2022; 5 - 8:30pm 
  • 1 hour - 1h 15 mins lessons on Mondays
  • Topics: Improvisation 101, Acting 101, Musical Theatre 101
  • Visit our Youth Classes webpage for more details

Spring Classes for Adults (Age 18+)

  • Week-long intensives over a 5-day week
  • January 17 - March 4, 2022; 7:30 - 9:30pm 
  • 2 hour lessons, Monday through Friday
  • Topics: Improvisation, Acting, Shakespeare, Playwriting
  • Visit our Adult Classes webpage for more details 

Summer Camps (Ages 10 -18)

  • Full day camps over the course of a week or two weeks 
  • June 6 - August 12, 2022; 9am - 4pm
  • Full day camps, Monday through Friday
  • Topics: Improvisation, Acting, Musical Theatre (acting, dance, voice), Sketch Comedy, Playwriting, and Shakespeare 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Develop curriculum and teach classes in Acting, Improv, Shakespeare, Musical Theatre (acting, dance or voice), or Playwriting
  • Communicates and builds rapport with students, guardians, staff, teachers, and stakeholders  
  • Maintains accurate records as required, including attendance and student medical and emergency information 
  • Maintain Covid-19 safety practices in the classroom
  • Represent education programs both within T2 and outside of T2 in a professional manner 
  • Other duties as assigned 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s degree in theatre, or equivalent work experience in related field
  • Experience teaching skills-based theatre classes to adults and/or young people
  • Full Covid-19 vaccination prior to the start date of the class/camp 
  • Ability to pass a full background check

DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Experience in curriculum design and development
  • Experience in standard teaching practices, including but not limited to classroom pedagogy, classroom management, and supervision for a variety of ages
  • Ability to work individually and as a team member
  • Ability to remain calm in high-pressure situations such as student conflicts, parent/guardian concerns, or managing unexpected obstacles.

TO APPLY

To apply, submit a cover letter, employment resume, and references by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/.  Additional submission of work samples is optional. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Our goal is to remove barriers to employment that are faced by racialized groups and encourage applicants of all genders, abilities, and ethnic, socio-economic, religious, and educational backgrounds. TheatreSquared believes that a team with a variety of perspectives and skills is critical to our growth as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. 

Please note: All interviews at this time will be held via video service (Google, Zoom, etc.) 

COMPENSATION

Compensation is highly competitive and commensurate with experience. This is an independent contractor position with an hourly wage of $20 - $35 per hour.

We believe that theatre—done well and with passion—can transform lives and communities. At the theatre, in schools and online, we create remarkable performances; broaden access; foster empathy, equity and cohesion; and gather with one another around art, conversation, food and other shared experiences in a welcoming, inclusive space.

Now entering its 16th season, TheatreSquared’s challenging, heartfelt, and intimate productions reach 60,000 patrons each year, including more than 20,000 students and their teachers. T2 fills a crucial niche in the region’s cultural landscape as the only year-round, producing professional theatre within a 150-mile radius, operating on an annual budget of $6 million. TheatreSquared employs trained artists from across the country to create its 330 annual performances and is contracted with Actors' Equity Association. The theatre is also Arkansas’s home for professional playwrights, developing scripts through the Arkansas New Play Festival in Fayetteville and Bentonville and producing new works and world premieres each year. TheatreSquared’s architecturally significant, 50,000-square-foot, two-venue permanent home was completed in 2019. For details on the facility, visit ournextstage.org. 

Fayetteville and Northwest Arkansas were ranked 8th by US News and World Report in its 2021 "Best Places to Live in the US.” Located in the scenic Ozarks and offering a low cost of living and high quality of life, this vibrant metro area recently surpassed the half-million population mark and is home to the headquarters of Fortune 100 companies including Walmart Stores, J.B. Hunt, Tyson, and peer world-class cultural institutions such as Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art.

node.description:
The Jones Center is looking for an Energetic, Detail Oriented and Organized Senior Accountant with verifiable experience. This position will work closely with other accounting team members and various operational staff members throughout the organization. We are an organization with a culture of service to our coworkers and our customers. The right candidate for this position must have a positive, "can do" attitude.

General Ledger Accounting Responsibilities including but not limited to:

  • Subsidiary Ledger Imports
  • Monthly Journal Entries
  • Financial Statement Preparation
  • Audit and Budget Preparation
  • Monthly Reconciliations of general ledger and bank accounts
  • Fixed Asset Accounting
  • Monitoring Cash Receipts
  • Monitoring Accounts Payable
  • Maintain Commercial Lease schedule and monthly billing.
  • Process Payroll in a backup capacity to Payroll Manager.

This position is a full-time salaried position and comes with a great benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, generous retirement contribution and matching, 10 paid holidays, and an outstanding paid time off plan.

Successful candidate must have a bachelor's degree in accounting or related field with a minimum of 3 years' experience in accounting. Strong technical skills, including knowledge and use of QuickBooks, proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Nonprofit experience preferred. Salary commensurate with education and experience.

About The Jones Center:

The Jones Center is a recreation, education, and event center for families located in downtown Springdale, Arkansas.

The Center boasts a year-round ice arena, junior-Olympic size lap pool, activity pool with a slide, world-class bike park, basketball court, fitness center, indoor track, conference center, and chapel/auditorium.

Our facility is home to regional youth sports such as the AquaHawgs swim team and the NWA Hockey Association as well as individual sports and activities like gymnastics, ballet, tae kwondo, and figure skating at affordable pricing for families.

The Jones Center offers both memberships and scholarships which include free fitness classes such as Zumba, yoga, Silver Sneakers, synergy, and spin classes. Several other nonprofit organizations operate within our 220,000 sq. ft. facility including, Camp War Eagle and Haas Hall Academy.

Our Purpose is to strengthen our community by serving families and nonprofits to enrich lives and celebrate all cultures.

The Jones Center is a place for everyone to learn, play, and belong.

The Jones Center is proud to provide a multigenerational, social, educational and recreational facility where "all are welcome" in the heart of Northwest Arkansas. The Jones Trust owns and operates the Center for Non-profits at the JTL shops on Emma and The Center for Non-Profits at St. Mary's in Rogers, AR. We are proud to partner with other Non-Profits in NWA to better serve the region. Working for The Jones Trust Entities provides unique opportunities to improve the community through service to others. Working together is crucial to fulfilling The Jones Trust Mission.

All candidates are subject to a post offer drug screen and background check.

For more information please contact Human Resources at hr@jonesnet.org

Jones Center for Families affords equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws.

node.description:
At AcreTrader, we empower our customers to buy and sell land smarter with advanced technology, data, and expertise. To stay committed to our mission as a company, we need to continue to grow our Accounting Teams within each business unit. AcreTrader is hiring an Assistant Controller who will work directly with our Corporate Controller. As the Assistant Controller, you’ll play a key role executing the accounting function while also thinking critically about the processes we use to run our business. Additionally, through this role you’ll have the opportunity to intimately understand each of our products and departments and make a significant contribution to the growth of our company.

Core Responsibilities: 

  • Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual consolidated financial statements for AcreTrader
  • Oversee month-end close procedures, including adjusting entries and account reconciliations
  • Oversee accounts receivable and accounts payable
  • Coordinating and assisting with the budget process
  • Contractual compliance review
  • Entity account maintenance management
  • Establishing and maintaining internal controls
  • Accounting process improvements
  • Manage annual 1099 submissions
  • Coordinate with external tax accountants
  • As at any growing company, you can expect many other tasks and responsibilities to be assigned as well as growth opportunities to be seized.

Key Competencies/Requirements: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field, or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of progressive accounting experience 
  • Strong analytical and problem solving mindset
  • Experience in Quickbooks Online
  • Hunger to build and create new and improved processes
  • Legal authorization to work in the United States is a precondition to employment at AcreTrader

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • CPA
  • Master of Accountancy (MAcc) and/or MBA
  • Experience in supervisory accounting position
  • Experience in real estate accounting
  • Experience in BrokerMint software 
  • Experience in Bill.com
  • Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
  • Strong background of internal controls

About Acretrader 

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and in order to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, read on.

AcreTrader is a real estate investing platform that makes it easy to buy shares of farmland and earn passive income. United States farmland has historically outperformed most asset classes and other forms of real estate. Unfortunately, buying and maintaining farmland directly is extremely difficult without local knowledge and management, as well as large investment commitments. AcreTrader solves these issues by providing transparency, flexibility, and ease of use to people wanting to invest in farmland while handling all aspects of administration and property management, from insurance and accounting to working with local farmers and improving soil sustainability. At the same time, AcreTrader works to help farmers scale through innovative sales and leasing opportunities. See our How it Works page for more details.

AcrePro, the brokerage arm of AcreTrader, provides best-in-class land valuation, sales, development, and conservation expertise to its customers. At the core of AcrePro is a highly qualified team, combining decades of experience in financial services and agriculture alongside millions of dollars in transactions. Our simple mission is to create a faster, more transparent way for buyers and sellers to transact in the world of farmland. AcrePro’s offerings include investing, land management, appraisal, auctions, diligence and evaluation, financing, land and resource conservation, and more.

node.description:
Director of FP&A 

AcreTrader is seeking a Director of Financial Planning and Analysis to add to our growing team. This person will be responsible for standing up the planning, forecasting, reporting and analytics functions within the business. This includes assessing data and technology needs within finance, creating a business cadence for deliverables, and supporting business unit leads with financial and decision support. In addition, this person will partner directly with the CFO and executive leadership team to drive corporate initiatives within HR, marketing, legal, and product. This is an exciting opportunity for a proactive financial professional that has an innate curiosity and passion for solving complex business problems

Core Responsibilities

  • Establish a recurring FP&A calendar with annual, quarterly, and monthly deliverables and accountabilities
  • Own and drive the long range planning and annual operating plan processes
  • Establish financial targets for each of the 3 business units within AcreTrader and develop tracking against each
  • Conduct decision support for 3 operating business units as well as all corporate priorities such as headcount planning and other cost initiatives
  • Work with business leaders to identify KPIs that drive our organization and put processes in place to measure them.
  • Participate in our board and investor reporting process.
  • Develop managerial reporting to satisfy needs of both internal and external stakeholders, present management reports to executive team with key insights to drive optimal business performance
  • Assess data needs to support core FP&A deliverables and partner with technology/product teams to source and centralize
  • Partner with controllership team to recommend ERP and EPM toolsets to accomplish business objectives, co-lead implementation of such
  • Partner with technology to address ongoing enhancements to FP&A toolsets

Key Competencies 

  • 7+ years relevant experience in positions that require analysis, reporting financial results, forecasting, budgeting, and interpretation of business impact and results
  • An ability to recognize insights within data sets and recommend actions to drive performance
  • Experience working with multiple business units, building relationships, and managing competing priorities
  • Proven ability to tell a story through data
  • Extensive track record driving complex projects and analyses to completion
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability explain complex financial topics in simple terms

Preferred Qualifications

  • MBA, CPA, or CFA preferred
  • Technology, agricultural, or real estate backgrounds a plus

About AcreTrader

AcreTrader launched in 2018 and has established itself as a leader in the farmland investment industry. Our team and company have grown at an incredible pace, and to continue this growth, we must do so intentionally. We have very high expectations for ourselves, each other, and every new team member. We’re looking for high performers who go about their work with a sense of curiosity and a drive to make things better. If you would like to be a part of a fast-moving operation with an opportunity to make a massive impact at the intersection of finance, technology, and agriculture—then please, get in touch.

AcreTrader is a real estate investing platform that makes it easy to buy shares of farmland and earn passive income. United States farmland has historically outperformed most asset classes and other forms of real estate. Unfortunately, buying and maintaining farmland directly is extremely difficult without local knowledge and management, as well as large investment commitments. AcreTrader solves these issues by providing transparency, flexibility, and ease of use to people wanting to invest in farmland while handling all aspects of administration and property management, from insurance and accounting to working with local farmers and improving soil sustainability. At the same time, AcreTrader works to help farmers scale through innovative sales and leasing opportunities. See our How it Works page for more details.

AcrePro, the brokerage arm of AcreTrader, provides best-in-class land valuation, sales, development, and conservation expertise to its customers. At the core of AcrePro is a highly qualified team, combining decades of experience in financial services and agriculture alongside millions of dollars in transactions. Our simple mission is to create a faster, more transparent way for buyers and sellers to transact in the world of farmland. AcrePro’s offerings include investing, land management, appraisal, auctions, diligence and evaluation, financing, land and resource conservation, and more.

AcreMaps aims to be the most comprehensive, accurate, and useful mapping tool for agriculture. There are over 50 million farmland owners in the world that require a better service to explore their land. That includes using satellite imagery to discover how land has evolved, pricing land at market values through valuation algorithms, and exploring many layers of underlying agronomic information. Our team solves complex computer science problems, designs beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improves the accuracy of our data to set the industry standard for mapping.

The Business Assistant is a part-time, integral member of TheatreSquared’s administrative staff, charged with assisting in T2's accounting, bookkeeping and finance. This position will support the business office with finance related data entry and basic accounting functions. Ideal candidates will have proactive communication skills, experience with managing both paper and virtual organization systems, and self-motivation. Additionally, this opportunity offers room for professional growth as the company begins its new phase in a state-of-the-art, 50,000-square-foot, two-venue home. This position reports to the Director of Operations.

As a business professional—and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this new staff member will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

The Business Assistant should expect weekly hours to range between 15-25 and scheduled during normal business hours. This role may be scheduled for external/special events as needed.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Credit card data entry
  • Sales and contributions data entry
  • Allocating income via journal entries
  • Managing payables and receivables
  • Creating payments and invoices
  • Collecting receipts and supporting documents

  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to process data quickly and accurately
  • Professional communication skills

The Commons Bar & Café located in TheatreSquared seeks several dedicated bartenders, baristas and/or line cooks, to work in a fine-casual, counter-service food and beverage program. Under the direction of commons bar management, this new team member will support the food and beverage experience located on the first and second floors of TheatreSquared’s brand-new $31 million dollar home located in Fayetteville, Arkansas. The Commons Bar & Café serves as a public and visible extension of TheatreSquared’s mission to be a “cultural commons, a gathering place for all segments of our community to share intimate, exceptional arts experience and to to create a welcoming and vibrant shared community space.” 

As a welcoming voice to newcomers visiting TheatreSquared and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this new staff member will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 

  • Members of the Commons Bar & Café team will be expected to display excellent customer service skills, an eagerness to learn, and a dedication to the integrity of food and beverage items served by the café
  • Team members will work together with T2’s marketing, development, and front-of-house staff to create a hospitable high quality continuum of service at all times, including during performances, high-volume hours, and special events
  • Team-based communication is required
  • Café staff will be expected to operate safely under health code and beverage control laws, as well as COVID-19 protocols and procedures enforced by T2 to ensure the safety of our patrons and staff
  • Support and uplift TheatreSquared’s mission and vision, as well as show a dedication to the company’s principles of inclusion, diversity, equity, anti-racism, and access

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be at least 21 years of age to apply
  • Flexible schedule with the ability to work days, nights, weekends, and or holidays
  • Prior experience in a fast paced food-service position

DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Previous wine and beverage experience, ability to make recommendations to customers requests

*Relocation assistance is available*

TheatreSquared seeks a Box Office Supervisor to join the organization’s box office as the company continues the transition to a new, world-class, two-venue facility. These staff members will maintain a culture of high-level customer service, efficient transactions, goal-driven sales, and effective communication aligning with T2’s mission and brand. The Box Office Supervisor will ensure a hospitable, smooth, and high-quality continuum of service at all times and act as an information resource for patrons regarding TheatreSquared programming and events. This position reports to the Ticketing & Sales Director.

As an engaged team member who regularly interfaces with patrons, event and group sales clients, and vendors, while coordinating closely with T2’s front-of-house staff – and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce – this new staff member will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change – helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”  

The Box Office Supervisor work schedule is Tuesday-Saturday, 2pm-10pm during show weeks and Tuesday-Saturday, 10am-6pm during dark weeks. This role may be scheduled for external/special events as needed. 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Work as box office lead for most show shifts, ensuring that patron concerns/issues are handled in an effective manner, reporting is complete and accurate, and cash handling is managed appropriately
  • Assist Ticketing & Sales Director with day-to-day operations of box office, including but not limited to daily reporting, ticket mailings, scheduling, cash handling, etc.
  • Assist Ticketing & Sales Director with season show building in Tessitura
  • Demonstrate excellent customer service skills and comprehensive problem-solving skills
  • Work to sell TheatreSquared season offerings, single tickets, and add-ons
  • Communicate information regarding performances and organizational policies to patrons
  • Answer patron calls and efficiently field requests
  • Monitor and respond to patron voicemails and emails in a timely manner
  • Complete inbound/outbound calling or mailing projects for ticket sales campaigns
  • Resolve patron ticketing issues while maintaining a positive and friendly interaction
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of TheatreSquared performances and events, as well as organizational policies
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date patron information in ticketing system (Tessitura)
  • Transact tickets and related purchases with the highest accuracy 
  • Manage cash drawers and make appropriate and accurate change
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Regular, reliable, and non-disruptive attendance is an essential job duty, as is the ability to create and maintain collegial, harmonious working relationships with others

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience in customer service
  • Able to accommodate a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as well as being able to perform in a fast paced, dynamic work environment 
  • Able to work well independently and as part of a dynamic team 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and documentation skills 
  • Able to successfully handle multiple priorities in sometimes high-stress situations 
  • Able to work with the public and possess conflict resolution skills 
  • Good problem solving and strategic thinking skills. 
  • Follow verbal and written instructions of management and accept feedback from management to improve performance
  • Able to learn and operate a Windows-based ticketing system (Tessitura)

 DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Knowledge of Tessitura system (or comparable CRM)
  • Experience in arts or other non-profit organizations

TO APPLY

To apply, submit an employment resume, references, cover letter and schedule availability by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/.

Compensation is highly competitive and commensurate with experience. The range for this salaried, exempt position is $36,000 - $40,000 annually. node.description:
TheatreSquared is seeking a class of eight apprentices for the 2022/23 Season. TheatreSquared’s Apprentice Program for emerging young professionals is designed to launch the careers of talented early arts leaders, with a special focus on candidates with lived experiences traditionally underrepresented in the American Theatre. In particular, the company has focused its recruitment on individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, People of Color (BIPOC).

Apprentices receive a living wage, personalized training, and an in-depth, hands-on experience with top-tier professionals at T2, serving as a launching pad for a lifetime career in professional theatre. Each participant has the opportunity to special mentorship in a designated focus area, with some aspects of running a theatre . The apprenticeship culminates in a group project where all apprentices work together to create and execute a program of their choosing. 

Available apprenticeship department focus areas include Marketing, Development, Education, Arts Management, Production Management, Carpentry, Scenic Painting, Lighting, Stage Management, Costumes, Artistic, and Community Experience/Events. For descriptions of each department click here. Please note, we do not offer an acting apprenticeship.

Apprentices report to the Director of Education

Apprenticeship program includes:

  • Mentorship from professionals in the field.
  • Professional development workshops.
  • Meetings with fellow apprentices where the group will engage with visiting artists, directors, and other guests. 
  • Ability to add to individual portfolios
  • A culminating apprenticeship group project, created and executed by the apprenticeship team. 

As an enthusiastic, early-career theatre professional—and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this new staff member will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Open availability for the duration of the program: August 15 - May 19, 2023. 
  • A passion for live theatre. 
  • Highly organized and proactive, with the ability to take initiative and manage multiple tasks and projects at a time and deliver within deadlines.
  • Must be goal oriented, self motivated, highly flexible and able to accept feedback.
  • Must have access to reliable transportation. 
  • Must be at least 21 years of age to apply.
  • Candidates must have received the full COVID vaccination and required booster shots prior to the start date of the program.
  • Ability to find and secure local housing. 

DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Background knowledge of, and experience in, theatre is preferred, but not required. 

TO APPLY 

To apply, submit your application by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/. Applications must be submitted no later than April 1, 2022. Selected participants will be notified by May 10th. 

TheatreSquared celebrates diversity and commits to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our goal is to remove barriers to employment that are faced by racialized groups and encourage applicants of all genders, abilities, and ethnic, socio-economic, religious, and educational backgrounds. TheatreSquared believes that a team with a variety of perspectives 

and skills is critical to our growth as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. 

Please note: All interviews at this time will be held via video service (Google, Zoom, etc.) 

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS 

This temporary, full-time position includes a weekly wage of $600, averaging 35 to 40 hours a week. Benefits include allotted show tickets, 5 days PTO, access to the company employee assistance program, and the opportunity to regularly experience professional, live theatre.

THEATRESQUARED MISSION

We believe that theatre—done well and with passion—can transform lives and communities. At the theatre, in schools and online, we create remarkable performances; broaden access; foster empathy, equity and cohesion; and gather with one another around art, conversation, food and other shared experiences in a welcoming, inclusive space.

ABOUT THEATRESQUARED & NORTHWEST ARKANSAS 

Now in its 16th season, TheatreSquared’s challenging, heartfelt, and intimate productions reach 60,000 patrons each year, including more than 20,000 students and their teachers. T2 fills a crucial niche in the region’s cultural landscape as the only year-round, producing professional theatre within a 150-mile radius, operating on an annual budget of $7 million. TheatreSquared employs trained artists from across the country to create its 330 annual performances and is contracted with Actors' Equity Association. The theatre is also Arkansas’s home for professional playwrights, developing scripts through the Arkansas New Play Festival in Fayetteville and Bentonville and producing new works and world premieres each year. TheatreSquared’s architecturally significant, 50,000-square-foot, two-venue permanent home was completed in 2019. For details on the facility, visit ournextstage.org. 

Fayetteville and Northwest Arkansas were ranked 8th by US News and World Report in its 2021 "Best Places to Live in the US.” Located in the scenic Ozarks and offering a low cost of living and high quality of life, this vibrant metro area recently surpassed the half-million population mark and is home to the headquarters of Fortune 100 companies including Walmart Stores, J.B. Hunt, Tyson, and peer world-class cultural institutions such as Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art.

node.description:
Production Technicians are members of the Production Department at TheatreSquared. Production Technicians will be assigned a primary division within the production department (scenic, costumes, lights, sound, props, etc) where they will fulfill the majority of their hours. As needed they will also be assigned to work with the other areas of production as well as assigned to work on run crews. Between productions, production technicians can expect to be working on organizational, maintenance, and repair projects. Production technicians may also be assigned to work with other departments and divisions at TheatreSquared including be not limited to: Events, Facilities, Company Management, and Community Experience.

Costume Focus

Production technician with a costume focus reports to the Costume Shop Manager. This technician will primarily work in the costume shop, building and preparing costumes for each production. This position is also expected to join wardrobe crews for productions as needed. 

As a key artist helping create shows that allow audience members to think beyond their lived experiences—and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this position will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Primarily work in the costume shop, reporting to the costume shop manager.
  • Work in other areas of production as needed including scenery, costumes, lighting, etc.  
  • Attend technical and dress rehearsals, previews and other rehearsals and performances as needed.
  • Maintain a safe, healthy, and clean work/shop environment.
  • Uphold the policies and procedures outlined in TheatreSquared’s Employee Handbook.
  • Professionally represent TheatreSquared to outside personnel including visiting artists, patrons, and rental clients.

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous experience working for a theatre or entertainment venue. Experience working in a regional theatre is preferred.
  • Strong candidates may have a particular focus in one area of production, but will have an understanding and willingness to work in other areas. (Ex: Primarily a scenic carpenter, but also familiar hanging and focusing lights)
  • Possess a desire to continue learning new subjects and techniques.
  • A willingness to adapt to a very flexible work schedule. 
  • Some focuses may require the ability to repeatedly lift, push, or maneuver up to 50lbs either alone or with assistance. May need to work at heights at times (ladders, personnel lift, catwalks).

DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Strong candidates will have a proficiency in costume construction and crafts.
  • Previous experience and comfort in some of the areas below:
  • Sewing (hand stitching and machine)
  • Wardrobe
  • Wig styling
  • Hair and Make-up
  • Scenic Painting
  • Carpentry
  • Crafting and Sculpting
  • Theatrical Lighting
  • Theatrical Audio

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

Compensation is commensurate with experience. Position is non-exempt and may be offered as full or part-time with an hourly rate of $15-$16/hr.

Full-time position benefits include health; dental; paid time off; relocation assistance; paid parental leave; professional development; employer-sponsored long-term and short-term disability; $100,000 in employer-sponsored term life insurance; and voluntary 401(k).

Part time position benefits include flexible scheduling; holiday pay; paid time off; allotted show tickets; access to the company employee assistance program; and the opportunity to regularly experience live theatre.

TO APPLY 

To apply, submit a cover letter, employment resume, and references by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/.

node.description:
The Sound Supervisor is a full time, integral member of TheatreSquared’s production staff, charged with carrying out TheatreSquared’s sound and audio needs. Additionally, this opportunity offers room for artistic and professional growth as the company continues to grow into their state-of-the-art, 50,000-square-foot, two-venue home. This position reports to the Director of Production.

As a specialized theatre professional—and as a positive, collaborative member of an inclusive workforce—this new staff member will help TheatreSquared answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Lead the loading in and striking sound systems for all productions and events
  • Support and collaborate closely with guest sound designers to achieve sound design  
  • Lead setup of audio equipment during the load-in process
  • Keep all audio equipment and systems in top performance (including Dante network, ALD system, building monitors and paging)
  • Maintain audio equipment; track wear and maintenance levels
  • Maintain all theater and audio storage spaces in a clean, safe and usable manner
  • Support guest sound designers through tech rehearsals and attend post-rehearsal tech note meetings
  • Design sound for productions when an guest designer is not engaged
  • Join run crews of productions and events as needed
  • Setup tech tables and intercom in coordination with other production area heads
  • Professionally represent TheatreSquared to outside personnel including visiting artists, patrons, and rental clients.
  • Supervisor staff and overhire technicians assigned to audio
  • Orient overhire technicians in procedures and safety rules
  • Collaborate closely with other production area heads
  • Attend production meetings, department meetings, staff meetings, etc as requested
  • Work in other areas of production as needed and schedule allows


T2 provides a dynamic working environment in which duties and responsibilities may change. Employees are expected to be flexible and responsive to changes in the scope of their duties.


QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience with theatrical sound equipment, systems, installation and procedures is required. 
  • Experience with entertainment networking systems
  • Experience mixing audio for musical theatre.
  • Ability to work flexibly as a team member and present a positive attitude in times of stress.
  • Ability to research and self-teach new skill sets in an ever evolving field
  • Self-motivated, with a solution oriented work ethic in order to provide the highest quality work possible, in a mutually supportive environment.
  • Ability to work at heights from ladders, personnel lifts, and catwalks.
  • Ability to repeatedly lift, push, or maneuver up to 50lbs either alone or with assistance.
  • While the typical workday will be standard daytime hours Monday-Friday, given the typical schedule of a theatre company, the position requires the flexibility to work a modified schedule with some nights, weekends, and being on call.  

DESIRABLE SKILL SETS

  • Experience programming Yamaha consoles
  • Experience working with Dante
  • Experience working with Qlab
  • Theatrical sound design
  • Soldering 

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

This full-time, exempt position includes an annual salary in the range of $46,000-$50,000. commensurate with experience. Full-time benefits include health; dental; paid time off; relocation assistance; paid parental leave; professional development allowance; employer-sponsored long-term and short-term disability; $100,000 in employer-sponsored term life insurance; and voluntary matching 401(k).

TO APPLY 

To apply, submit a cover letter, employment resume, and references. This position is currently open and T2 looks forward to having the Sound Supervisor start as late as July 1st, but is willing to make accommodations for the right candidate.

TheatreSquared celebrates diversity and commits to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. node.description:
Position: Director of Strategy and Innovation

Reports to: Chief Operating Officer

Team: Operations

Status: Full-time, Exempt

Location: Office in Bentonville, AR

Last Revised: February 2022

Join our Team in the heart of Northwest Arkansas! Lifewater is an established Christian non-profit and community development organization walking with the rural poor to end the global water and sanitation crisis. For 45 years, we have served more than 2.5 million people in 40+ countries with life-saving safe water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) practices. Lifewater currently serves in Cambodia, Ethiopia, Tanzania, and Uganda.

Position Overview

The Director of Strategy and Innovation is responsible for turning Lifewater’s strategy into deliverable actions, working cross-departmentally to facilitate change and growth. The position is responsible for the oversight and direction of project and data-driven innovation. 

The Director of Strategy and Innovation’s primary responsibilities include:

  • Work closely with members of the Senior Leadership Team, identifying new opportunities, and integrating our faith into the Lifewater Strategic Plan
  • Assist in the development of the Lifewater Strategic Plan, working with other senior leaders in the implementation and decision-making process
  • Manage a portfolio of projects cross-departmentally, identifying and prioritizing critical projects for organizational strategy and design
  • Collaborate and coordinate with internal stakeholders to help solve business problems and promote innovation focused on strategic goals
  • Identify areas where data-driven decision making is vital, work with the technology team on identifying the data sources and providing insights
  • Oversee the creation and development of actionable analytics, performance management, key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) for the Programs, Development, and Operations teams
  • Execute complex strategic and operational initiatives
  • Provide leadership, mentorship, and direction to junior team members, building a highly functional collaborative team
  • Other duties as assigned

Work Experience and Qualifications

Required Qualifications

  • Adherence to Lifewater’s statement of faith
  • Passion for Lifewater’s mission of serving vulnerable communities and children
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution
  • 10+ years of proven experience leading innovative teams
  • 8+ years of experience using project management software
  • 8+ years of experience focused in business strategy and/or innovation development
  • Experience with Power BI or similar tools
  • Experience in building a performance management function, organizational KPIs and OKRs
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Domestic and international travel as needed
  • Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship will be provided

Preferred Qualifications

  • Well versed in Agile Methodology
  • Project Management certification. PMI-ACP preferred
  • Previous experience working in the non-profit sector
  • Experience working in a data-driven organization

Physical Qualifications

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at a time
node.title: Director of Strategy and Innovation

node.description:
Position: WASH Innovation Engineer

Reports to: Senior Innovation Manager

Team: Programs

Status: Full time, Exempt

Location: Office in Bentonville, AR

Position Overview

The WASH Innovation Engineer is responsible for identifying and driving technical innovation for Lifewater’s water and sanitation infrastructure solutions. The incumbent will manage innovation projects from inception to completion, with focus on comprehensive research and excellent data-driven analysis (including lifecycle cost estimation). The WASH Innovation Engineer will focus on the following areas:

Primary Responsibilities

  • Direct engineering innovation efforts within Lifewater’s water and sanitation solutions.
  • Manage development of tools and processes to streamline best-in-class engineering design and efficient, cost-effective construction.
  • Develop capacity building materials for new water and sanitation infrastructure solutions and processes, and lead training for staff.
  • Provide direct support and review for program teams as new water and sanitation infrastructure solutions and processes are being adopted.
  • Institutionalize new water and sanitation infrastructure solutions and processes among engineering staff.
  • Proactively look for ways that new learnings and sector best practices can be integrated into Lifewater’s water and sanitation infrastructure strategy, processes, and standard operating procedures.
  • Build external connections and make recommendations on consultants, academics, engineering organizations, water technology suppliers and R&D organizations that we should partner with to achieve our objectives.
  • Other duties as assigned

Other Requirements

  • Regularly collaborate with team members across projects and subject areas
  • International travel 2-3 times per year; domestic travel 1-2 times per year

Work Experience and Qualifications

Required Qualifications

  • Adherence to Lifewater’s statement of faith
  • Passion for Lifewater’s mission of serving vulnerable communities and children
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in Civil or Environmental Engineering
  • 2+ years hands on experience in an international development context
  • A minimum of 2 years of WASH experience
  • Experience with piped motorized pumping solar powered water systems
  • Exceptional written communication and cross-cultural interpersonal skills
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to travel internationally and/or domestically multiple times per year
  • Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship will be provided

Preferred Qualifications

  • Advanced degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering
  • Professional Engineer (PE) license
  • Familiarity with project management software, such as Asana

Physical Qualifications

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds at a time
node.title: WASH Innovation Engineer

node.description:
Essential Job Duties

Safety/Security Sensitive Designation:

This is a safety/security sensitive position for purposes of the Arkansas Medical Marijuana Amendment.

  1. Provide good customer service to both internal and external customers, maintain positive and effective working relationships with other City employees (especially members of their own team), and have regular and reliable attendance that is non-disruptive.
  2. Responsible for operating a communications console and related equipment to dispatch police, fire personnel and after hour city on-call staff in response to requests for assistance in emergency situations in accordance with established departmental procedures and policies.
  3. Main Police Channel – Dispatch and monitor all radio traffic generated by Police Personnel related to calls for service and self-initiated activity. Includes directing the "net" during emergency situations and being able to determine when calls should be held for cross beat dispatching versus calls that have priority.
  4. Fire Dispatch Channel – Dispatch and monitor all radio traffic generated by Fire Personnel related to calls for service and self-initiated activity. Fire incidents require several tasks to be done at the same time, i.e. locating hydrant information, weather information, monitoring on scene times, paging notifications when policy dictates, etc.
  5. Police B Channel – Information channel which handles all informational request from officers to include driver's license checks, criminal history checks, vehicle checks, want and warrants checks from in-house computer, calls for a wrecker, incident number and times, etc. This channel handles non-emergency police radio traffic during emergency situations when the main police channel has the net directed.
  6. 911 Public Safety Answering Point – Answer all 911 calls for City of Fayetteville including medical calls. Goal is to answer within 6 seconds. Must know procedures for call taking and be able to deal with callers who might be irate, under the influence of alcohol and drugs, obscene, suicidal and mentally impaired. Must know procedure for adding on the language line, contacting various emergency agencies such as poison control, and other agencies not in our jurisdiction. Must be able to interpret map data when a wireless call is received. Responsible for recording and entering 911 data for statistical purposes.
  7. Citywide Channel- Dispatches and monitors this channel for after hour city emergency calls. Including Animal Services, Meter, Water/Sewer, Transportation, etc. Responsible for monitoring this channel for traffic from all city agencies. Must know each department/division's policy for emergency calls. Must be able to notify various contacts for these departments depending on their needs, i.e. Arkansas One Call, Arkansas Highway Department, etc.
  8. Police Department Business Lines – Must be able to answer this line within 3 rings. This responsibility requires transferring of calls from other agencies or departments, answering questions regarding civil matters, handling irate, drunk, obscene, suicidal and mentally impaired callers in a professional manner. Dealing with multiple phone calls virtually at the same time. Must be able to answer questions on a variety of topics and/or find out where to get the answers, i.e. related to special events in town, weather, other agencies, business and address locations, etc.
  9. Enter stolen property and wanted persons into the Arkansas Crime Information Center System. Validate all records entered by following policies created by ACIC. Second party review of all entries.
  10. Update informational books kept in dispatch such as position books, disaster book, and fire book. Updating pre-arrival information kept in the AS400. Updating special instructions, this is information on who to call after hours in case of emergency on all businesses in Fayetteville.
  11. This job requires regular, professional, and diplomatic contact with vendors, citizens, business owners, local public safety agencies and outside representatives.
  12. Maintain trespass log – this is for when officers notify dispatch that a person was warned of criminal trespass and used not only by the officers but also the prosecuting attorneys office; extra patrol log – these are requested by citizens for extra patrol in a particular reasons such as out of town, traffic problems, etc; this log lets officers know where these requests are so they can be checked. Briefing log – dispatchers log information items for officers to read about variety of topics such as stolen vehicles, officer safety items, etc.
  13. Record Maintenance-such as making sure names are attached properly, addresses are entered without overrides, etc.

Secondary Job Duties

  1. Tactical/Special Event Dispatch – some dispatchers are assigned to this duty. Respond with Emergency Response Team to various call-outs. Work the command post and special events independent of the dispatch center
  2. Secondary duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

  1. High school diploma or GED and prefer one year of Public Safety Dispatcher or related experience.
  2. Ability to obtain ACIC (Arkansas Crime Information Center) Level I and II certification within six (6) months of date of hire.
  3. Ability to meet all NIMS (National Incident Management System) training requirements within six months of employment.
  4. United States Citizen; not less than 18 years of age; must not have any felony convictions.
  5. Must possess a valid Driver's License; must possess ability to obtain valid Arkansas Driver's License within 30 days of hire.
  6. Pass pre-employment dispatch testing
  7. Effectively communicate with others orally and in writing.
  8. Ability to perform duties in a high stress environment dealing with energetic personnel.
  9. Must be proficient in the use of a computer, multi-line telephone and other related software programs. Must be able to effectively operate standard office equipment. Data Entry speed must be higher than 7000 KPH.
  10. Must be proficient in the use of radio system, radio computer, computer aided dispatch system, mapping computers, weather radio, Arkansas Crime Information Center Computer, 911 computer, telephone system, recording systems, Fire Alarm Panel, and Telephone Device for the Deaf through 911 equipment.
  11. This position requires the ability to speak clearly and be understood on radio systems, as well as understand what is being said by others on the radio systems, to ensure safety of self and others.
  12. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.
  13. While performing the functions of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee regularly is required to stand, walk, and sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required to accomplish computer and office work.
  14. Offers of hire will be contingent upon successfully passing a drug screen and criminal background check.
  15. While performing the functions of this job, the employee is in an outdoor environment for tactical/special event assignments, and training.

node.description:
Work for the market leader of construction tools at MARSHALLTOWN. Our facilities are top-notch and company culture is healthy. Decisions are made quickly, good ideas are embraced, excellence and effort are rewarded, and we have the resources to do what we need to do. Solving the problems of a large and highly automated manufacturing and distribution company are interesting and exciting. If you want to be a part of a team that strives to manufacture superior quality tools, works hard, is nimble, and challenges status quo, then this might be the right opportunity for you!

 

Our Fayetteville, AR location is seeking a Buyer to join our Purchasing team. The Buyer is responsible for the procurement of raw materials and finished goods to support a manufacturing and distribution environment from both domestic and international suppliers. These products are to be secured at competitive cost and quality levels with appropriate delivery schedules consistent with Company policy and established performance standards. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to, identifying new sources of supply and working with existing suppliers to reduce costs and improve quality.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


  • Purchases raw materials and finished goods items as necessary based upon production schedules, current inventory levels, and policy as well as price and potential availability
  • Expedites delivery and follows up on purchase orders as necessary
  • Submits quotes for raw materials and purchased items as requested
  • Investigates and resolves vendor-related production and quality problems
  • Resists all price increases, notifies management of impending changes and accepts only those that can be justified
  • Maintains working relationship with existing and prospective vendors by interviewing their representatives and through on-going contact on the telephone or through the mail
  • Other duties and project work as assigned; essential functions may be supplemented due to the absence of others or changes in business conditions

 

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:


  • Bachelor’s degree in Business-Related or Engineering field, required
  • Basic understanding of MRP Materials Resource Planning operating principles, required
  • Strong communication skills to effectively negotiate and communicate with suppliers and vendors
  • Effective organizational & project management skills through proven experience
  • Excellent PC skills utilizing Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook
  • Team orientation with ability to be self-directed

 

MARSHALLTOWN offers comprehensive total rewards packages to include competitive wages, matching 401k retirement plans, dental, Traditional and High Deductible Health Plans with employer HSA contributions, immediate vacation eligibility, just to name a few!

 

 

MARSHALLTOWN is proud to provide equal employment opportunity to individuals regardless of race, ethnicity, color, creed, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, protected disability or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal or local law.
node.title: Buyer

node.description:
Main Responsibilities

This position will prioritize the following tasks:

  • Managing all operations of company retail store, such as budget, cleaning in-store pickup, inventory, and hiring, training and managing retail staff
  • Coordinating and overseeing all retail-related events (pop-ups, sales, etc.)
  • Decorate and merchandise in-store product in a creative way
  • Manage all store customer service
  • Envision and develop an engaging, fun, and vibrant workspace that embodies our company’s culture to our local customers

B-Unlimited is growing at such a rapid rate and we are hiring strategically to fill our team with A+ players who are quick learners, thought leaders, and problem solvers. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us. Below you’ll find a bit about the vision of B-Unlimited, who we are to our clients and customers, and who we strive to be to one another internally. We believe very strongly in the values of our people and that we all strive to be better humans to ourselves, each other and to our customers. The below should give some direction to that.

 

B-TEAM EXPECTATIONS

OUR MISSION - "from thought to cloth" 

OUR VISION - "To be the world's most unique, original, & innovative t-shirt company in the eyes of our employees, communities, & most importantly our customers."   

OUR ETHOS - Be unique. Be yourself. Be unlimited.

ORGANIZATIONAL VALUES      

  • RESPONSIBLE - Our planet was here long before us and will be here long after. We choose to invest our time & efforts effectively for our future and yours. 
  • COMMITTED TO EXCELLENCE - We are truly skilled craftspeople that care deeply about every part of the process, like elves, but way more likeable.
  • PEOPLE FOCUSED - Yeah, we make great t-shirts. But our true end-goal is to celebrate and love all people. And yes, this means you!
  • CREATIVE - Whether it's design, systems, or just plain problem solving, we have the ability to see something that doesn't exist and make it a reality. 

BEHAVIORAL VALUES          

  • LIFE GIVING - Open-minded, empathetic, respect for all, & carrying emotional intelligence with a positive outlook.
  • PERSONALLY ACCOUNTABLE - Reliable, disciplined, & takes ownership of responsibilities & actions.
  • ENGAGED - Great listener who is supportive, clear in communication with a focus on collaborative propensity and a willingness to learn.
  • AUTHENTIC - Being honest to yourself & others about your strengths & weaknesses. Exudes integrity, authenticity & trustworthiness.
  • SERVANT-MINDED - Putting the needs of others before yourself. See the need, acknowledge the need, act on the need.
  • CLEAR COMMUNICATOR - Direct, responsive & efficient conversations in all mediums. 

Quarterly Bonus based on Quarterly Company Sales Goals: 

  • Bronze Goal: 1 Day's Pay Bonus 
  • Silver Goal: 3 Days' Pay Bonus 
  • Gold Goal: 5 Days' Pay Bonus 

Benefits:

  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance paid at 75% for employee and 25% for family (subject to change based on renewals) *eligible after first 60 days of employment
  • Matching 401K of up to 4% of your salary after meeting qualification criteria 
  • Gym membership at Fitness One (NW Arkansas Locations)
  • 5 days of PTO years 1-3 (after first 60 days of employment), 10 days after 3 years, and 15 days after 5 years
  • 12 days of annual paid company holidays

Requirements

The person in this position must have the following characteristics:

  • Extremely organized and efficient
  • Strong leader with a desire to mentor and train
  • Creative and have a strong eye for aesthetics
  • Outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communicator able to navigate complex situations with HQ, customers, and employees
node.title: Retail Store Manager

node.description:
THE B-TEAM

We’re so glad you’re interested in joining our team. Here are some things you should know about any full-time position within our company:

Our Culture (aka expectations) - B-Unlimited team members should possess:

  • Strong Work Ethic - We get shirts done. We’re the largest capacity producer in the state of Arkansas, and we have unparalleled turnaround time and customer satisfaction. That’s because we all work hard, all the time. Well, except for when it’s play time!
  • Attention to Detail - Every step of the printing process requires scrutinizing attention to detail. The smallest oversights result in really expensive corrections, so we need team members who aim to get it right the first time.
  • Strong Communication Skills - Unlike most printing companies, we house sales, art, production, and shipping all in one space. Every print job is a collaboration between all of these departments, and we use Slack, Pipedrive, walkie talkies, e-mail, text, and good old fashioned words to get things done. Clear, kind, and quick communication is a must.
  • Collaborative Propensity - Everything that we create is the product of collaboration. Teamwork is a must, and our team is built of people who are both dependable and adaptable, humble yet take pride in their work, and take initiative while being understanding.

The Regional Sales Manager (Custom Apparel Sales) position includes the following responsibilities: 

  • Build new territories with a primary focus on recruiting new customers
  • Identify sales leads and follow up with new business opportunities 
  • Building and maintaining successful relationships with prospects and existing customers
  • Meet with customers to create new design ideas and plan semester-long orders for events
  • Travel to meet with customers at other campuses
  • Maximize business reach and potential 
  • Customer service and customer retention
  • Oversee and work as a team with other staff on all orders from beginning to end, which includes all steps between the initial design idea and the final delivery of the product
  • Serve as a liaison between the customer and the art and production departments
  • Quick to respond - efficient and timely
  • Communicate in an organized, clear, and concise manner via email and phone to effectively curate and maintain customer relationships
  • Cost analysis and pricing on each order
  • Manage sales of online products by loading jobs on e-commerce website
  • Monitor and report the success of each customer account
node.title: Sales Team - Regional Sales Manager

THE B-TEAM

We’re so glad you’re interested in joining our team! To find out more about who we are and what we do, check out our story. Here are some things you should know about any full-time position within our company:

The Good Stuff (aka perks) - all full-time B-Unlimited employees have access to the following:

  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance paid at 75% for employee and 25% for family (subject to change based on renewals)
  • 401K match of up to 4% of your salary
  • 12 company-wide paid holidays each year, plus 5 PTO days (with additional accrual based upon tenure)
  • 40% off of all retail attire.
  • Starting pay - $13.00-$16.00 hourly (depending on experience).
  • Evening shift 2:30 PM - 10:30 PM Monday - Friday.

Our Values: (aka expectations) - All B-Unlimited team members should possess:

The Details (aka, position descriptions) - QUALITY CONTROL SPECIALIST / PRESS ASSISTANT / SCREEN ROOM TECHNICIAN 

These positions are entry-level positions that involve being on your feet for long periods of time, standing, walking, and some lifting, moving, and stacking.

Position Responsibilities: QUALITY CONTROL

This position prioritizes the following tasks:

  • Last line of defense in ensuring quality
  • Verifying sizes, counts, and order breakdowns - ensuring 100% accuracy of order
  • Monitoring print quality
  • Other screen printing duties as needed: taping screens, cleaning screens, with the overall focus on facilitating print jobs in a timely manner
  • After shirts are printed, ensure that printed jobs are properly counted and sorted

Position Responsibilities: PRESS ASSISTANT

This position prioritizes the following tasks:

    - Ensure's efficient job setup and tear down

    - Communicate's well with Press operator and Quality control specialist

    - Must be dependable and personally accountable

    - Attention to detail is a must to ensure high standards of quality.

    - Have a high standard of cleanliness and maintain the equipment used throughout the day

Position Responsibilities: SCREEN ROOM TECHNICIAN 

The ideal candidate for this position will have the following characteristics:

    - Organized and attention to detail

    - Ability to transition from task to task / Multitask  

    - Dependable and personally accountable

Potential Future Responsibilities

We are looking for team members who want to grow and develop! Here are some potential opportunities within this company:

This position could become a trainer, press operator, and press assistant to cross-train in different departments to learn all printing production aspects.
