node.description:
Job Title:     Laboratory Technician

Department: Clinical, Research & Development

Job Description

Namida lab is a biotech company located in Fayetteville, Arkansas. We specialize in novel biomarker diagnostics. Laboratory Technician will assist with analyzing clinical and research laboratory specimen following standard methods and procedures. Experience in ELISA based assays is a must.

Responsibilities

§ Day to day supervision or oversight of the laboratory operation and reporting test results.

§ Maintain laboratory records, organize results, and provide suggestions for improvement in laboratory automation and increased productivity.

§ Design and execute Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and document all R&D and clinical work appropriately within the guidelines of internal policies.

§ Must always be accessible onsite. Provide direct communication with other personnel and consultation to resolve technical problems in accordance with policies and procedures.  

§ Perform internally developed immunological assays on patient samples for both R&D and Clinical purposes.

§ Assist with current and future assay development and further validation of new assays for use in a clinical laboratory.

§ Comfortable presenting results in both a team setting and independently where identification of problems adversely affecting test performance or result reporting are of critical importance.

§ Responsible for accurate specimen processing, test performance, and reporting of test results in a timely manner.

§ Ensure all laboratory's procedures are followed for specimen handling and processing, test analyses, reporting, and maintaining records of patient test results.

§ Adhere to internal quality control policies and document all quality control activities, instrument and procedural calibrations and maintenance performed.

§ Responsible for the daily surveillance of lab equipment and performing routine maintenance as well as documenting all necessary validations and qualifications.

§ Routine checks of laboratory inventory and assist in ordering laboratory supplies.

§ Responsible for notifying General Supervisor or R&D Scientist of problems encountered during the operation of the department. Ensure that technical decisions (i.e., changes to control ranges, etc.) are approved by the General Supervisor or R&D Scientist before changes are made. Keep the General Supervisor or R&D Scientist informed regarding all problems affecting the technical operation of the laboratory.

§ Responsible for other duties as requested by administration, General Supervisor, or R&D Scientist, and Laboratory Director.

Work Environment 

This job operates in a professional office and laboratory environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers, smartphones, automated liquid handlers, and standard laboratory equipment. 

Physical Demands 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work 

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Overtime and weekend work may be required. Work hours may change based on company needs. Open to considering part-time position for the right candidate.

Travel 

Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected. 

Required Education and Experience

§ Bachelor’s degree in clinical laboratory science, medical technology, or chemical, physical, or biological science; OR Associates degree in medical laboratory technology and two years laboratory training or experience, or both, in high complexity testing laboratory.

§ Prior ELISA and pipetting experience. Hands-on experience with Microsoft Excel required.

§ Able to prepare and handle solutions, media, and reagents according to specification for the required assays. Note that the work may require the handling of biohazardous materials.

Preferred Education and Experience

 ·      One year of training and experience in high complexity testing clinical laboratory

Other Duties 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
node.title: Laboratory Technician

node.description:
Position: IT Specialist

Location: Office in Bentonville, AR

Status: Full-time

Reports to: Senior IT Manager

Position Overview

The IT Specialist is responsible for providing technical support for Lifewater International. The IT Specialist will focus on providing support for hardware and software issues, web development and maintaining hardware and software for Lifewater.

The IT Specialist’s primary responsibilities include:

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Serve the Lifewater staff with technology and systems support and requests, including any hardware or software issues
  • Support technology team with integration solutions and troubleshooting
  • Report on and provide solutions for any data issues or analytical trends
  • Contribute to the development of data, dashboards, reports, and other technology processes
  • Ensure that technology tools maintain a high level of performance
  • Serve as an applications administrator for various IT platforms

Work Experience and Qualifications

Required Qualifications

  • Adherence to Lifewater’s statement of faith
  • Passion for Lifewater’s mission of serving vulnerable communities and children
  • Experience as applications administrator for Microsoft and Azure platforms
  • Experience providing hardware and software support to both office and remote employees
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship will be provided

Preferred Qualifications

  • Degree or certification from an accredited institution in Computer Science, Technology, Data Science, Information Systems, or related field or experience.
  • Basic experience using business intelligence platforms such as PowerBI
  • Basic experience in information security
  • Experience in administration of Salesforce, Slack, Asana, NetSuite, and VMWare
  • Web development experience

Physical Qualifications

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at times.

Compensation

Lifewater offers a competitive salary with excellent benefits. Benefits include health, dental, vision, life insurance, and a retirement plan. The non-monetary compensation includes a unique opportunity to be part of an innovative, meaningful, and fun organization that is changing the world.

Who We Are

Lifewater International ("Lifewater") is a non-profit Christian community development organization dedicated to effectively serving vulnerable children and families by partnering with underserved communities to overcome water poverty. With experience in more than 40 countries since 1977, Lifewater serves people by providing them with contextually appropriate water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) interventions. We walk alongside families, leaders, schools, and churches to overcome all forms of water poverty by helping them learn to live in healthy relationship with God and the environment and to recognize how small changes can transform their life and community.

We serve communities in the rural regions of East Africa and Southeast Asia, with active programs in Cambodia, Ethiopia, Uganda, and Tanzania; countries with a desperate lack of resources to provide basic water and sanitation services to rural children and families. We have offices in Bentonville, AR; Addis Ababa, Ethiopia; Kampala, Uganda; Shinyanga, Tanzania; and Siem Reap, Cambodia, as well as individual program offices. Since our inception, Lifewater’s worldwide team has impacted the lives of more than 2.5 million people. And we’re just getting started.

node.description:
About the job

About The Role

The Marketing Manager is responsible for owning the local, regional and national marketing portfolio within the Ropeswing Hospitality Group. The Marketing Manager will be the Brand Ambassador for Ropeswing Hospitality Group and will require a thorough understanding of business and marketing strategy. It also requires the ability to project manage, multi-task and problem solve in a fast-paced environment.

Key responsibilities will include overseeing and developing marketing campaigns; conducting research and analyzing data to identify and define audiences; devising and presenting ideas and market/sales strategies; promotional activities/social content; compiling and distributing financial and statistical information; writing and proofreading creative copy.

This is a salaried, exempt position and reports directly to the VP of Bars and Restaurants.

Salary Is Commensurate With Experience.

Please submit a cover letter, resume and Marketing portfolio, if applicable.

Benefits/Perks

  • Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits.
  • 401k match after 2 months of service (must be 21 years or older).
  • Employer paid Short-Term/Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance benefits.
  • Paid Time Off + Company Holidays
  • Maternity/Paternity Leave + Bereavement Leave
  • Cell-Phone Allowance
  • Employee Assistance Program, Bicycle Share Program.
  • 50% discount at Ropeswing establishments for employees and up to 1 guest.

Additional details concerning Benefits/Perks will be provided at time of employment.

Essential Functions & Duties

  • Provide monthly reporting of social and restaurant event + programming analytics to better understand guest needs, team actions and development of insight-based marketing plans. Share relevant insights and planning across ecosystem.
  • Schedule, organize, and maintain creative content; direct/manage socials to create and post engaging content across social media platforms for operations.
  • Research and analyze marketing trends and identify target markets.
  • Lead and facilitate brand definition, articulation, and continued evolution of the brand platform.
  • Oversee customer experience measurement and insight.
  • Ensures brand guidelines are adhered to in all media outlets and mediums.
  • Create new opportunities in each of the operations to stand out, including culinary opportunities, partnerships, and collaborations.
  • Identify events & programming calendars that generates revenue and enhances guest experience for operational units; conduct outreach and marketing against those events.
  • Coordinates and manages the execution of marketing tactics. Tactics may include, but are not limited to newsletters, styled photo shoots, influencer programs, digital marketing campaigns, print publication, ad coordination, and merchandise creation and promotion.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to deliver brand assets.
  • Collaborate with marketing and communications team in ecosystem to elevate RSHG properties and cross promote with internal businesses/brands when appropriate
  • Coordinate and manage day-to-day activities that lead to the completion of marketing projects and tasks.
  • Coordinate and manage creative design services for development and collateral production using internal and external sources.

What You Need to Get the Job Done

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing or another related field, preferred but not required.
  • 4+ years of Marketing experience, preferably in the Hospitality and Restaurant Industry, preferred but not required.
  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills; ability to cross-collaborate with different stakeholders,
  • Excellent project management skills,
  • Ability to juggle competing deadlines while remaining flexible and goal/detail oriented,
  • Knowledge of current and upcoming marketing trends and multimedia platforms,
  • Subject matter expert in all relevant social platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, SurveyMonkey, etc.)

Employment contingent upon completion of a satisfactory background check.

In our commitment to wellness in the community, Ropeswing is proud to offer a smoke-free environment for all of our guests and employees.

*Ropeswing is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we value diversity. All employment is based on merit, qualification, and business need.*

What you’ll be doing:

  • Learn to perform routine maintenance tasks on HVAC equipment such as checking refrigerant systems, electrical components, replacing filters, cleaning system components, basic trouble shooting.

  • Learn to evaluate performance of HVAC equipment.
  • Learn to correctly document all phases of work including work order notes, invoice notes, truck stock sheets, checklists.
  • Learn to effectively use all software and technology Paschal uses for field technicians.
  • Learn the specific guideline that Paschal uses for interacting with customers.

  • Possess great mechanical aptitude.
  • Strong ability to read and understand technical instructions.

  • Computer Knowledge.
  • Must be able to adapt to changing and growing work environment.
  • Must be clean, maintain a professional appearance, and communicate well with customers.

node.description:
Harps Food Stores is expanding its Advertising Department and has an immediate opening for a full-time Graphic Artist. 

If you had been with us for the last month, you would have:

  • Created weekly/biweekly grocery ads.
  • Developed signage kits for mobile app launch.
  • Designed, printed, and trimmed signage for in-store promotions.
  • Designed special flyers for in-store events and sales.
  • Designed large foam board signs for in-store display.
  • Designed and updated digital graphics on jumbotron road sign.
  • Created graphics for website, email, mobile app, & social media.

The best candidate for this job will have:

  • Associates Degree, or higher, in Graphic Design, or related field.
  • Proficiency in InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator.
  • Ability to meet timely deadlines.
  • Ability to adapt brand identity to various creative projects.
  • Familiarity with Apple iMacs.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Ability to leverage resources, whilst also knowing when to ask questions.
  • Slight addictions to coffee.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Basic knowledge of digital photography.
  • OCD level of organization, preferred but not required.
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office Suite.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to handle multiple projects at a time.
  • Punctuality- 8-5 Monday-Friday on-site is required.
  • Knowledge of grocery retail, a plus but not required.
  • Frequently lift and move up to 10 lbs to shoulder height unaccompanied.
  • Occasionally lift and move up to 25 lbs to waist height unaccompanied.
  • Regularly sit for duration of shift.
  • Occasionally required to walk, stand, stoop, climb, or balance.

Employment at Harps may be contingent upon completion and our evaluation of a PEP survey, RMAI assessment, Wonderlic assessment, personality assessment, drug screen, employment reference check, credit check and criminal background check.

As a Graphic Artist, this is how I do it:

Building Relationships – I successfully initiate, develop, and foster relationships with others. I take a personal interest in the interests and ideas of others and treat others fairly, respectfully, and sincerely. I empathize with the emotions of others and consider things from other people’s perspectives.

Conscientiousness – I demonstrate responsible behavior, thoroughness of work, and dependability. I consistently demonstrate compliance with Harps’ policies and procedures, including regular and timely attendance, adherence to dress code and ensuring a safe work environment, and a willingness to complete other duties as assigned.

Integrity – I demonstrate and act in accordance with an appropriate and sound set of values, beliefs, and business ethics. I am an honest person.

Modeling Cultural Values – I act consistently in accordance with values that are consistent with those of the organization. I model high standards of behavior for others through personal actions and commitment to the organization.

Professionalism – I hold myself accountable by demonstrating a “no excuses” approach to my own attitude, performance, and results. I work in the best interest of Harps even when it involves putting individual needs aside.

Showing Drive & Taking Action – I act on my own initiative without being prompted. I handle problems with minimal guidance. I make things happen and take action quickly.

As a Graphic Artist, this is why I do it:

Respecting Others/Citizenship – I encourage an atmosphere of teamwork by my own actions. I support others, facilitate their work, and defend them when appropriate. I encourage cooperation and trust within a group. I show a high concern for the rights, values, and worth of others. I treat others fairly and consistently. I give appropriate attention toward the concerns expressed by others by empathizing with their emotions and considering things from their perspective.

Supporting Harps’ Mission Statement – With respect and support from my peers and supervisors, I strive daily to exceed my customers’ expectations in an effort to support the Harps’ Mission Statement – “Our mission is to provide the best overall value to our customers, building a reputation for competitive prices, product quality and freshness, friendly service and cleanliness.”

node.description:
Position summary: Essential member of the Milestone Leadership team responsible for supporting the operational needs of the organization. This role also supports our finance processes and customer relationship software, and provides project coordination as necessary.

This role is part-time and flexible, primarily remote with some in-person team meetings and customer programs. There is potential for this role to grow as the company grows and to add additional responsibilities based on the employee’s skill set and interests. Working at Milestone Leadership allows you flexibility while providing growth and career developing opportunities.

Role qualifications: 

  • Highest standards of professionalism and personal and professional ethics. Able to relate to all levels of an organization – executive to individual contributor.

·     Communicates clearly and expressively. Thinks quickly, strategically, and logically.

  • Excellent organization skills, multitasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to operate independently, work proactively, and to achieve results without close supervision.
  • Highly organized with a high attention to detail.
  • Demonstrate an ability to work well in a highly collaborative team atmosphere.

Position responsibilities: 

  • Operational support for the organization, which may include:
  • Managing supplies
  • Supporting Project Coordinators in program preparation and logistics
  • Managing company inbox, calendar, and voicemail
  • Travel logistics
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Finance support, which may include:
  • Monitor and manage expense receipt process in partnership with accountant
  • Monitor and manage invoice tracking process
  • Assist Partners in reconciling monthly P&L reports with annual budget
  • Serve as liaison between Accountant and Milestone team – includes monthly submission of hours for payroll
  • Provide regular updates and reports as requested
  • Assist in developing efficient financial management and reporting processes
  • Occasional project coordination:
  • Planning, logistics, and implementation of Milestone Leadership programs as necessary

Essential skills and experience: 

  • Clear understanding of values-focused leadership principles.  
  • Ability to represent Milestone Leadership in various business settings in a professional manner.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills. Exceptional interpersonal skills.
  • Proficiency in computer software systems including Microsoft Office.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail with ability to prioritize workload.
  • A problem solver – an ability to turn chaos into systems.
  • Excellent analysis and Salesforce management skills.

Preferred skills and experience: 

  • 1-2 years of Salesforce experience
  • Basic understanding of accounting reports

Education: Bachelor’s degree in related discipline or equivalent work experience.

Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to walk; stand; sit; use hands; reach with hands and arms; balance; stoop; talk and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Mental Requirements:

General Intelligence, Numerical Intelligence, Verbal Intelligence, Motor Coordination Skills, Coordination of Eyes, Hands, and Feet.

Workplace Environmental Conditions:   

The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal.
node.title: Operations Coordinator

node.description:
Arkansas Swim Academy provides exceptional swim instruction to our community that builds confidence and develops safety skills in a student-centered environment. We are committed to training our staff to teach swim lessons, giving them the tools they need to be successful. This is a diverse, inclusive and supportive workplace. 

Why Choose Arkansas Swim Academy?

  • You get to work with kids, teaching a life skill that could be life saving
  • It's a fun, creative, flip flop friendly environment
  • Every day is different with new chances to make a difference

As a swim instructor you are responsible for the safety of each class and teaching swim skills to students using our proven curriculum. You will work to build water confidence within your students, encouraging each student to rise to the best of their abilities. You can expect to be regularly communicating with students and fellow staff members. You should be someone who welcomes feedback and is a continuous learner. As a swim instructor you will report to the Deck Supervisor or Site Supervisor during shifts and provide support throughout the pool deck as needed.

We have a fun and rewarding work environment with a great atmosphere for someone who loves teaching and being around water. We offer paid training. Starting wage is negotiable with prior experience. This is a part-time position that requires afternoon/evening and weekend shifts. We require our swim instructors to obtain their lifeguard and CPR certifications.

Responsibilities:

  • Make sure everyone is safe.
  • Love and respect students while teaching them to swim.
  • Be a team player who is who is consistently dependable and reliable.
  • Complete required training and be a continual learner.
  • Follow our curriculum with a focus on the needs, abilities and comfort of each student.
  • Smile and have fun during your entire shift.

Qualifications:

  • Caring and compassion for children and adults
  • Ability to work in the water for periods of up to 5 hours
  • Strong communication skills
  • Great attitude and willingness to be coached
  • The ability to focus in a fast-paced environment
  • The ability to commit to at least 1 year of employment, afternoons and weekends required
  • Required to obtain a Lifeguard and CPR certification

Benefits:

  • Fun team atmosphere
  • Competitive pay
  • Employee discounts/swim lessons
  • Fitness membership

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
node.title: Swim Instructor / Lifeguard

node.description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Systems Support Technician is a permanent part time position. This position is expected to work between 26-36 hours on a weekly basis. The Systems Support Technician implements, operates, maintains, and repairs a variety of hardware and software systems in a highly diverse technical environment. He or she will demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of PC- and server-based systems in a LAN/WAN environment. The Systems Support Technician will provide primary end-user support for all mobile devices, PCs, MACs, and server-based systems in the Cooperative.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS

 Reports to:  Systems Support Lead

 MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

 ·        Provides primary-level technical support to all OECC employees in use of IT supported hardware and software, including mobile devices, PCs, MACs, printers, LAN/WAN troubleshooting, and repair, as necessary. Provides supervised

support of servers, and Telephone systems as directed.

·        Installs, configures, troubleshoots, and maintains computer hardware, software, and data communication equipment; loads, tunes, configures, and upgrades operating systems for PCs, MACs, mobile devices, and Servers. 

·        Diagnoses and resolves computer and software problems; analyzes end-user requirements and recommends appropriate solutions.

·        Assists in maintaining and administering local area networks; customizes and enhances computer software; evaluates system performance and reports to management; performs preventative maintenance of equipment. Recommends

replacements and related system changes.

·        Maintains files and databases pertinent to the operation of the IT Department.

·        Assists in inventory of hardware, software, and telecommunications equipment.

·        Maintains a record of work and Help Desk activities including installation, repair, maintenance, replacement, and testing of computer hardware and software; maintains system documentation.

·        Actively assists in activities related to improving the Help Desk ticket system and accompanying reporting methods.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities.

 The Systems Support Technician shall be required to perform any other duties assigned to fulfill the objectives of the Cooperative.

EXTERNAL CONTACTS

 ·        Vendors: To evaluate and order new equipment. To report equipment malfunction, resolve hardware and software issues, and/or to keep updated on current technology.

POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

 Education, Job Knowledge and Training: At least two years of college level computer science or equivalent technical training certification is required or may substitute with three years’ experience in the installation, setup, troubleshooting and maintenance of computers and peripheral equipment or related software in a networked environment. Must maintain up-to-date knowledge of uses and functions of IT equipment and related technical requirements via certifications and/or training programs as directed.

 Equipment Operated: All specific equipment related to Information Technology as well as routine office equipment. Must have valid driver’s license without violation, which would prohibit insurability.

Abilities and Skills: Must demonstrate the ability to communicate technical information both written and verbally to immediate supervisors, peers, vendors, and end users. Must be able to perform complicated research, reporting, and querying of data.

Physical Effort: Occasional lifting, up to 30 pounds, required. Normal vision and hearing required.

Working Conditions: Work is performed in an office environment with higher and/or longer noise level than average. Weekends, evening hours, overtime and/or overnight travel may occasionally be necessary

Ozarks Electric is an EOE/AA/W/M/VETERAN/Disability employer
node.title: Systems Support Technician - Permanent Part-Time

node.description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Commercial Project Specialist is responsible for acting as the single point of contact and management for multiple client orders. Providing excellent customer service and working with internal and external stakeholders to ensure on-time delivery in accordance with customer and company expectations. Client responsibilities include on-going client interaction, timeline updates and support during and after installation. Support business development representatives in the sales process including assisting in lead management and contract generation. The ideal candidate will possess excellent critical thinking skills, communicate well with all levels of personnel and be highly organized. OzarksGo, LLC, is a subsidiary or Ozarks Electric Cooperative Corporation.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS

Reports to: OzarksGo Business Development Manager

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

·        Accountable for their client's overall customer satisfaction.

·        Responsible for timely project completion and billing

·        Ensures clients clearly understand status of project throughout all phases; including outstanding, pending and completed

tasks,

·        Meet the highest standards and minimize the customers attrition rate

·        Meet deadlines and update Sales Team members with status.

·        Collects and records documentation including customer set-up documents and communicating changes

·        Facilitates efficient and effective internal team and external customer meetings

·        Interface directly with customers to communicate implementation schedule, on-going project status, issues and

responses to questions. The communication vehicle will be via face-to-face meetings, email, and/or conference calls at

regularly scheduled intervals.

·        Provide post installation support services and trouble resolution

·        Assist in qualifying leads that come through and generating contracts if necessary

·        Must understand all the OzarksGo products and services and how they can be applied to help businesses succeed.

·        Provide support when needed for businesses, community anchor institutions, and MDU's to ensure customer satisfaction.

·        Perform any other related duties as required or assigned.

 

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities.

 

The Commercial Project Specialist shall be required to perform any other duties assigned in order to fulfill the objectives of OzarksGo.

EXTERNAL CONTACTS

·        Extensive contacts with various diversified sectors of the public environment; wherein, the contacts are of major

importance and failure to exercise proper judgment can lead to substantial losses to the organization.

·        Contacts with other departments or offices and also frequently with individuals in middle level positions; consulting on

problems which necessitate judgment and tact in presentation to obtain cooperation or approval of action to be taken.

Also, important contacts with associates as required in advanced supervisory jobs, plus frequent contact with senior level

internal officials.

POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

Education, Job knowledge and Training: High school diploma is required. BA/BS Degree in a business-related field or 3+ years of service delivery experience and/or 5+ years of telecommunications experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Equipment Operated: Must be able to operate all equipment normally found in an office environment. Must have valid driver’s license without violation, which would prohibit insurability. 

Abilities and Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with

strong organizational skills. Agile thinker, quick learner, ability to multi-task and adapt in a fast-paced setting. Anticipates and analyses problems clearly and determines appropriate solution or alternatives. Self-starter, motivation for personal, team and company goals and objectives.

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Able to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to prepare and interpret bar graphs. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram formats.

Physical Effort: While performing the functions of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear; frequently required to stand, walk, use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and occasionally required to sit, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision; distance vision; color vision; and depth perception.

Working Conditions: This position is performed both inside and outside the office, with some irregular working hours. Some travel is required inside and outside the Cooperative service area.

The physical activities and environmental characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions and expectations.

OzarksGo, LLC, is an EOE/AA/W/M/VETERAN/Disability employer.

node.description:
Fossil Cove Brewing Co. is seeking a Bartender/Beervangelist. This position requires someone with a passion for customer service, a positive outlook, strong work ethic, interest in craft beer and ability to connect with the customer.

If interested please send your resume and cover letter to: info@fossilcovebrewing.com or drop by the Tasting Room and give it to us in person!

Job Description: Bartender, Beervangelist

Daily Duties, Functions, Responsibilities:

  • Properly serve a selection of craft beers, cider and wine.
  • Effectively communicate Fossil Cove offerings and recommend craft beers to consumers
  • Provide excellent customer service
  • Educate customers about craft beer and tell the Fossil Cove story
  • Represent Fossil Cove with enthusiasm
  • Effectively use P.O.S system
  • Clean, maintain and keep bar, back bar, storage and customer seating areas
  • Foster a welcoming environment
  • Achieve customer education goals
  • Responsibly serve and work around alcohol products
  • Maintain high service standards
  • Work effectively as a member of the service team
  • Accomplish other tasks as needed Skills/Experience desired:
  • Excellent Customer Service
  • Passion for people
  • Love of craft beer
  • Cicerone Certified Beer Server
  • Barista Experience a plus
  • Effective communicator
  • Knowledge of craft beer styles and brewing process
  • At least 1 year serving/bartending experience or equivalent skills
  • Interest in beer education
  • Ability to lift heavy objects, +50lbs, safely
  • Ability to safely work in brewery environment
  • Work efficiently and stay focused in high volume situations
  • Passion for craft products and getting involved in local communities Schedule: 20-30hrs/wk. Evening and weekend availability required.

node.description:
The Assistant Audience Services Manager, a crucial part of the Community Experience area at TheatreSquared, provides leadership for the company’s front-of-house Welcome Team to ensure a hospitable, smooth, and high-quality continuum of service during all times and especially during performances, high volume hours, and T2 special events. 

As a leader of TheatreSquared’s front-of-house staff, this team leader will serve as the secondary House Manager for the company. The assistant house manager's principal responsibility is to ensure the quality of experience for our patrons from the moment that they arrive at the theatre to the time that they leave. Responsibilities include overseeing ushering/seating, lobby and audience seating areas, and, in conjunction with box office staff, troubleshooting ticketing and seating issues. The Assistant Audience Services Manager will support the training of all front-of-house employees to perform all capacities with professionalism and integrity, and instruct volunteers to work in the same fashion. 

As a key link between the company and the public—and between audience and art—this staff member will help TheatreSquared to answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

The Audience Services Manager will:

  • Supervise T2 Front-of-House Welcome Team during performances and special events
  • Lead the house management efforts in tandem with the Audience Services Manager—maintaining entrance controls, empowering the welcome team to solve patron concerns in real time, and working closely with stage management to begin each performance. 
  • Help maintain documentation and training materials for Welcome Team
  • Support service standards and techniques to provide speedy service of high integrity
  • Distribute performance reports for every event when acting as the lead house manager
  • Provide rapid response for critical issues during high-volume service times
  • Help maintain communications around staff-led curtain speeches and talkbacks 
  • Manage TheatreSquared’s volunteer usher program and help build its volunteer base
  • Support the presentation of the facility daily with special emphasis prior to performances and special events
  • Be available to accommodate a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as well as being able to perform in a fast paced, dynamic work environment  
  • Work closely with the staff of the Commons Bar/Café, supporting efficient and high-quality service pre-show, at intermission, and after 
  • Collaborate with the Events Manager in providing support as a TheatreSquared host or events liaison during community events
  • Report to the Audience Services Manager and Director of Community Experience 

QUALIFICATIONS

Preferred candidates will have:

  • Ability to work well independently and to manage, train, and motivate others  
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and documentation skills 
  • Ability to successfully handle multiple priorities in sometimes high-stress situations  
  • Ability to work with the public and possess conflict resolution skills  
  • Good problem solving and strategic thinking skills

Additional skills and experience that are preferred, but not required, include experience with Tessitura or another Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform and proficiency in Microsoft Office.

Finally, the ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong passion for TheatreSquared’s mission and vision, as well as a dedication to the company’s principles of inclusion, diversity, equity, anti-racism, and access. 

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS 

This full-time, exempt position with an annual salary of $36,000, commensurate with experience, and full benefits. These benefits include health; dental; paid time off; relocation assistance; paid parental leave; professional development allowance; employer-sponsored long-term and short-term disability; $100,000 in employer-sponsored term life insurance; and voluntary 401(k) and/or Roth IRA.

TO APPLY

To apply, submit a cover letter, employment resume, and references by visiting https://theatresquared.bamboohr.com/jobs/.  

TheatreSquared celebrates diversity and commits to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The company’s goal is to remove barriers to employment that are faced by racialized groups and encourage applicants of all genders, abilities, and ethnic, socio-economic, religious, and educational backgrounds. TheatreSquared believes that a team with a variety of perspectives and skills is critical to our growth as an organization, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Please note: All interviews at this time will be held via video service (Google, Zoom, etc.). 

THEATRESQUARED MISSION

We believe that theatre—done well and with passion—can transform lives and communities. At the theatre, in schools and online, we create remarkable performances; broaden access; foster empathy, equity and cohesion; and gather with one another around art, conversation, food and other shared experiences in a welcoming, inclusive space.

THE COMPANY & REGION

TheatreSquared’s signature offering of bold new plays in an intimate setting has driven its growth to become the state’s largest theatre, offering more than 300 performances annually and operating on a $6 million annual budget. The playwright-led company is one of mid-America’s leading laboratories for new work, having launched more than 60 new plays. Its work has received critical acclaim from The New York Times (“Best Theater of 2020” list), The Wall Street Journal (“an outstanding drama company”), NPR’s All Things Considered, and the American Theatre Wing, founder of the Tony Awards.

TheatreSquared’s home—winner of the 2020 American Architecture Award and the AIA NY Honor Award—is a cultural landmark. T2’s hometown of Fayetteville is annually ranked among the top ten US News and World Report "Best Places to Live,” a progressive, bike-friendly, and scenic college community near several Fortune 100 world headquarters. TheatreSquared’s remarkable expansion—with a twentyfold increase in audience in just the past decade— parallels the emergence of its home region as a booming population center and destination for American art.

Offering far-reaching access and education programs and an open-all-day gathering space, TheatreSquared remains rooted in its founding vision, that “theatre—done well and with passion—can transform lives and communities.”

node.description:
TheatreSquared seeks a Marketing Associate to join the organization’s team as it seeks to develop a larger, more loyal, and more inclusive audience in its brand-new, $31 million home. Under the direction of the Director of Marketing and Communication, this team member will support driving ticketing and earned revenue for the non-profit organization in a culture of high-level customer service and effective communication. This staff member will also create and maintain materials that align with T2’s mission and brand. 

The Marketing Associate role will have a special focus on creative copywriting, reporting, online advertising, and audience research/development.

By expanding the theatre’s audience with a commitment to inclusion and access, this key staff member will help TheatreSquared to answer the question, “How can a theatre be an agent of social change—helping foster a community that is fundamentally more equitable?”

The Marketing Associate will:

  • Compose compelling copy for show campaigns, email campaigns, web headlines, and press releases—ensuring that messages are supportive of and consistent with marketing strategy and T2’s aspiration to attract, engage and inspire audiences
  • Assist in monitoring active marketing programs, delivering content via social media channels, email, or direct mail, and developing ways to improve those campaigns
  • Create weekly reports and analysis for direct mail, ad placements, and email blasts
  • Collaborate to conduct market analysis to keep up with changing demographic and other relevant issues to assist with evaluating marketing and communication activities
  • Assist with maintaining and updating database
  • Submit ideas for marketing initiatives designed to enhance and grow the company's audience in Northwest Arkansas and online
  • Work closely with the team to create graphic pieces for display, mailing, advertorial placement, and other signage
  • Represent TheatreSquared at community events, gatherings, and festivals to grow awareness and participation
  • Lead additional research, administrative tasks and or special projects as needed
  • Report to the Director of Marketing & Communications and Marketing Manager

Finally, the ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong passion for TheatreSquared’s mission and vision, as well as a commitment to the company’s principles of inclusion, diversity, equity, anti-racism, and access. 

TO APPLY

To apply, submit a cover letter, employment resume, and references.

Please note: All interviews at this time will be held via video service (Google, Zoom, etc.)

node.description:
Looking for meaningful work in a caring culture? Want to apply your attitude and skills to make a difference in your local community? As the Destination Marketing Organization for the City of Rogers, Visit Rogers increases opportunities by promoting the destination, developing the Rogers brand, and supporting the entire Rogers community.

We need an innovative and passionate individual to join our dynamic team as Destination Sales Manager, promoting Rogers to small meetings and associations, sporting events, group tours, and other designated markets, creating economic opportunities for our partners and the community.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

• Dedication to building community through tourism

• Passion for collaboration in a team environment

• Desire to master best sales practices in the hospitality industry

• Knack for creating and executing sales strategies that increase business and economic impact to the destination from the assigned markets.

• Excellent verbal communications and presentation skills.

• Bachelor’s degree in Business or Hospitality related field.

• 2 years relevant work experience in hotel or hospitality sales and customer service highly preferred.

• Overnight travel is required

Visit Rogers offers a competitive salary and benefit package commensurate with experience. This full-time, non-exempt position reports directly to the Director of Sales and Executive Director, and is a member of the Visit Rogers team, a division of the Rogers-Lowell Area Chamber of Commerce. The Chamber’s vision is to build business and grow community. The Rogers-Lowell Area Chamber of Commerce is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage all candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

TO APPLY: Email a cover letter of interest and resume to jr@rogerslowell.com. Qualified candidates only will be contacted for consideration.

node.description:
Graphic Designer

TC Screen Printing & Apparel’s Home Office in Siloam Springs is looking for an experienced Graphic Designer.  This position is full-time Monday - Friday 8:45 am - 5 pm.   Applicants must be reliable, drama-free, and thrive in a collaborative work environment. 

This position covers all things related to art and design, with a focus on bringing customer concepts to life.  Projects can include anything from decorated clothing and accessories, to creation of SWAG, banners, stickers, as well as logo and brand development.  Our designers work closely with our Sales Team and Project Managers to develop graphics, merchandise, and product lines that will serve our customers’ needs and exceed their expectations.  Designers also work with our Production Team to insure the highest quality product is delivered to our customers. 

Designs created at TC are not limited to customer concepts and projects.  Here at TC, designers are also responsible for our own in-house retail lines, t-shirt and merch subscriptions, and special projects.  We are looking for designers and artists who can concept new ideas, help bring those ideas to life, and collaborate to create products our entire team is excited about.

Primary Position Goals:

 -Design for daily customer orders including mockups and custom design, ranging from quick and simple line design to complete custom art creation

 -Clear and concise communication with Project Managers and the Production Team to ensure quality products

 -Bring ideas from early concepts, thumbnails, and sketches to complete, print-ready art creation

 -Conduct research and maintain awareness of design trends and products related to our projects

Candidate Attributes:

-Strong work ethic

-Drama free

-Thrive in collaborative work environment

-Adaptable and coachable

-Highly organized and able to multi-task

-Established time management capabilities

-Eye for detail and quality

-Clear communicator and good listener

-People-person

-Quick learner

Candidate Skills:

-Bachelors degree in Graphic Design or experience equivalent

-Minimum 3-5 years experience in Adobe Creative Suite, with primary focus in Illustrator and Photoshop

-Decorated apparel/screen printing industry experience strongly preferred

-Strong graphic design ability with proven history of professional and commercially successful graphics

-Proficiency on Mac computers

-Professional verbal and written communication skills

-Understanding of the full product lifecycle from concept to final product

This rad job also comes with a well-rounded benefits package including PTO, quarterly bonus structure, health insurance and expense reimbursement, wellness reimbursement, IRA matching, and more. As a company, we also encourage extra learning opportunities by way of workshops, trade shows, and outside shop collaboration. 

It is a privilege for each of us to work at TC each day. We are grateful that we get to do business in Northwest Arkansas in the middle of two of the friendliest communities around. We design custom clothing for everything from classrooms to boardrooms to retail brands, and we do excellent work.  We want to add someone to the team who is equally enthusiastic about all these things. 

How to Apply:

1 - Brush up that resume. Resumes are a helpful formality, but we are most interested in hearing what makes you come alive, how you would bring that into this position at TC, and how we can help you get to where you want to go both personally and professionally.

2 - It would go a long way if you knew something about our company, and the best way to get the feel for who we are and what we do would be to check out our Instagram and Facebook feeds. Please do not show up to an interview with zero knowledge of TC just looking for a job.

3 - Email resume, cover letter and portfolio to radjobs@tcscreenprint.com.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Negotiable based on experience and skills

﻿Commercial Framers/Rough Carpentry Needed

We are currently accepting applications to fill positions for Commercial Framers/Rough Carpentry. Candidates must have own transportation, be willing to travel and be highly motivated. Drug screen, physical and criminal background check is required of successful candidates.

Job Qualifications:

Fundamental Skills:

  • Safety practices, including selection and application of personal protective equipment, fall prevention devices, barricades, warning and signaling devices, etc.
  • Communication skills, including use of written, verbal, and graphic materials to convey information (i.e. written specs, blueprints, pictures, drawings, etc.)
  • Proper selection and use of hand tools, small and large power tools, lifting and hoisting equipment, measuring tools, etc

Measurement Skills:

  • Proper selection and use of measuring tools and instruments, including tape rules, scales, rules, levels, etc.

Layout and Alignment Skills:

  • Correct application of optical and laser instruments and measuring tools for establishing center lines and elevation, as applied to installation and alignment of machinery and equipment.

Performs any combination of the following duties on construction projects:

Activities include but are not limited to:

  • Prepare the layout of the project
  • Estimate height, width, length, and other proportions
  • Select materials.
  • Work with blueprints or instructions from supervisors.
  • Work with materials such as wood, plastic, fiberglass, or drywall.
  • Check work along the way to ensure it's up to code and specifications.
  • Install partitions, doors, and windows.

Requirements:


  • Possess own hand tools to perform required tasks
  • Ability to wear a full body harness and work at heights while tied off
  • Willing to Work and have reliable Transportation
  • Ability to work, day, swing, and night shifts (sometimes long hours)
  • Must have 2 years of experience in construction
  • Must have valid Driver's license and pass Driver's background check
  • Must Pass Drug Test
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet
  • Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Ability to work in safety sensitive construction zone, around large machinery and heavy equipment
  • Ability to work cooperatively with a team in a fast-paced and complex environment

Job Type: Full-time

Available Benefits: Health/Vision/Dental/Supplemental Insurance, Holiday Pay, Vacation Pay

node.description:
Camp Underbite is a doggy daycare and boarding facility located in Highfill, Arkansas, 1.5 miles from XNA Airport. We are seeking a Camp Counselor to assist in the care of dogs staying at our facility. 

Skills/Aptitudes:

  • Must have a track record of dependability
  • Must love animals
  • Must be comfortable with physical activity and spending large portions of the day outside, on their feet, in all seasons.
  • Must be able to lift at least 30 pounds on a regular basis (bags of food, dogs). 
  • Must be at least 18 years of age

Duties: 

Yes, you will play with dogs, but this job requires much more. Providing and maintaining a safe environment for our campers and staff is the overall priority. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, bathing and drying dogs, feeding and watering the dogs, cleaning the facility and grounds, focusing on dogs’ body language, remembering dogs’ names, providing customer service as needed, taking photos and videos, and performing miscellaneous duties as assigned. Training will be provided, but candidate must show aptitude in recognizing animal behaviors and taking steps to ensure safety. 

Schedule:

Weekends and holidays are our peak times, so availability during these times is essential. This job will start as part time, but there is full time potential. Candidate must be dependable and have transportation to and from work, as to be punctual for scheduled shifts. 

If you are interested in this opportunity, please complete our application on Indeed.com. Please, no calls or drop ins.

Check out our Facebook Page or website to learn more about us!

node.title: Development Coordinator

node.description:
Description

Bella Vista is located in the NW corner of the state of Arkansas. Our city boasts nearly 100 miles of bicycle/walking trails that wind through beautiful hills and trees and around seven (7) lakes within the city limits. Bella Vista is a wonderful place to live and work, particularly if you are an outdoor enthusiast. 

The Trails Manager will be responsible for managing the City’s comprehensive trails program, which includes overseeing the city’s existing trails systems and facilitating the implementation of the city’s master trail plan by working closely with city staff, contractors and other agencies. Essential to the position is the collaboration and coordination with other City departments, County and regional agencies, community groups and various stakeholders.

Essential duties will include but not be limited to:

  • Manage all aspects of the City’s trail system including oversee maintenance needs and agreements, event scheduling, permitting, budgeting for contracted projects. 
  • Coordinate with local foundations, community partners and related stakeholder groups. 
  • Manage and distribute timely and relevant information to Communications Department for necessary dissemination to residents and general public for promotion of trails updates and events.
  • Prepare and manage trail program budget items based on the Departmental and grant funding for future trail projects and maintenance needs each year. 
  • Manage contractual services and agreements according to established policies and procedures.
  • Ensure compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials (AASHTO), Federal Highway Administration (FHWA), National Association of City Transportation Officials (NACTO) and the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices (MUTCD) and implement the best practices outlined for all trail and on-street bicycle projects.
  • Receive and administer trail maintenance requests from the citizens, determine the necessary solution and coordinate with the     responsible departments or organizations for resolution. 
  • Manage the design and implementation of scheduled trail maintenance inspections and repair of items including bridges, railings, trail pavement and lighting. Oversee maintenance of city trails via the existing maintenance agreement with the Bella Vista Property Owners Association (POA).
  • Work in partnership with the City's existing volunteer programs and efforts in recruitment, training, and implementation of volunteer projects.
  • Be familiar with the process and necessity of reviewing development plans to identify and oversee the dedication of property and the construction of trails associated with private developments, including presentations to the Planning Commission, as necessary to continue the implementation of trail plans. 
  • Serve as the designated representative on the Razorback Greenway Alliance to provide consistent guidance for the operations and management of the Razorback Greenway.
  • Meet with local and regional trails groups and attend local and national bike and transportation expos, seminars and events.
  • Supervise the development of citywide bicycle, pedestrian and trails educational and encouragement efforts by conducting public presentations to inform and educate trail users, as well as plan and execute community events and workshops.
  • Serve as the primary contact for local and regional event organizers requesting the use of trails for their events, including permitting and scheduling, assistance with route/course development and securing necessary and requested police and fire personnel for the safest execution of the event.
  • Create and share reports highlighting trail count/usage and other relevant data. 
  • Routinely ride all levels of trails (Easiest to Extremely Difficult) to observe current condition.
  • Will occasionally be required to perform physical maintenance of trails such as weed eating, trimming of branches, removal of litter, etc. as issues arise needing immediate attention.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

 Education/training/abilities desired include:

  • Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent, related training.
  • Two (2) or more years’ experience organizing and managing trails systems, events, or other similar responsibilities. 
  • Ability to passionately serve with a ‘trails ambassador’ mindset while representing a diverse community in a thoughtful, balanced way.
  • Clear & concise verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to foster relationships with variety of individuals. 
  • Self-directed and able to maximize use of time, resources and technology.
  • Exemplifies professional conduct and adherence to City values.
  • Must be available to work some evenings, weekends, and occasional holidays, including some overtime hours.
  • Must be outgoing and enjoy working with citizens of all ages.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Possess excellent diplomacy skills.
  • Ability to give and receive feedback graciously; and to be a thoughtful team member.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to present to the public.
  • Ability to regularly walk, hike, and bike outdoors on city trails in conditions that, at times, may be harsh.
  • Ability to operate maintenance equipment such as weed eaters, branch trimmers, etc. 
  • Ideal candidate will be an avid cyclist who is familiar with or becomes familiar with Bella Vista and surrounding trails system.
  • Ability to pass pre-employment drug screen and background check.

The City of Bella Vista has an excellent benefits package that includes a 457 retirement plan with a 2 to 1 employer match (up to a 5% personal contribution).
node.title: Trails Manager

node.description:
Job Type

Full-time

Description

Bella Vista is located in the NW corner of the state of Arkansas. Our city boasts nearly 100 miles of bicycle/walking trails that wind through beautiful hills and trees and around seven (7) lakes within the city limits. Bella Vista is a wonderful place to live and work, particularly if you are an outdoor enthusiast. 

The Planning Technician provides technical, administrative, and clerical assistance to the Planning Division. The incumbent works closely with the public on a regular basis to provide customer service on planning matters. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Provide good customer service to both internal and external customers, maintain positive and effective working relationships with other City employees (especially members of their own team), and have regular and reliable attendance that is non-disruptive.
  • Serve as initial point of contact for phone and walk-in Planning inquiries. Work closely with the public on a regular basis to educate or provide customer service on planning issues and/or explain the intent and scope of a proposed development or regulation. 
  • Conduct site visits, permitting, inspections and a variety of projects that have been submitted to the Planning division.
  • Review planning permit applications for completeness, accuracy, and compliance with development regulations—including fence, sign, retaining wall, minor variance, home occupation, and other development applications as needed. 
  • Assist with zoning inquiries, and conduct research by looking up history of previous actions including zoning, conditional uses, variances, splits, and other information for a given parcel number.
  • Investigate perceived planning violations, and conduct site visit(s) to confirm compliance with the Municode.
  • Serve as clerk/recorder for the Planning Commission and Board of Zoning Adjustment, as needed.
  • Attend public meetings, assisting planning staff as appropriate by providing technical support.
  • Note: Meeting attendance will include early evening hours that are outside of normal office hours. 
  • Assist in the preparation, production, and distribution of the Planning Commission and Board of Zoning Adjustment meeting packets (compilation of agenda, minutes, staff reports and recommendations, supporting exhibits for each project, and additional information as needed) to the established Meeting Packet distribution list. (Planning Commission, Board of Zoning Adjustment, other City Departments, and utilities, outside agencies, media, groups, and individuals, etc.). 
  • Coordinate public noticing requirements for public hearing applications, as needed.
  • Assist CDS with a variety of other duties as needed. 
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Associate’s Degree in a related field, plus two years of related work experience. A bachelor’s degree in a related field is preferred, and may substitute for two years of work experience. 
  • Possess or ability to obtain and maintain a valid Driver’s License from the State of Arkansas.
  • Ability to manage time effectively, work independently and to make sound judgments and decisions.
  • Ability to be flexible, adaptable, and balance priorities. 
  • Ability to give and receive feedback graciously; and to be a thoughtful team member. 
  • Ability to understand, explain, and apply appropriate City codes, ordinances, regulations, and policies.
  • Possess the ability to read and comprehend codes, policies, specifications, legal descriptions, and boundary maps of real property, maps, and development plans and plats.
  • Must possess excellent organizational skills.
  • Ability to consistently communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to effectively present information, respond to questions, and confer with city employees as well as the public. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
  • Ability to read and understand maps, technical drawings, codes and specifications.
  • Knowledge of applicable safety practices and procedures.
  • Ability to work in outdoor conditions that, at times, may be harsh. 
  • Ability to traverse rough topography with obstacles. 
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office and database applications maintained by the City or County.
  • Basic knowledge of Geographic Information System (GIS) applications.
  • Ability to pass background screen and drug test.

The City of Bella Vista has an excellent benefits package that includes a 457 retirement plan with a 2 to 1 employer match (up to a 5% personal contribution). 

NOTICE : 

ALL APPLICATIONS MUST INCLUDE A COVER LETTER STATING WHY YOU ARE INTERESTED IN & QUALIFIED FOR THIS POSITION.
node.title: Planning Technician

node.description:
The Walton Family Foundation is seeking a skilled digital media professional to join the Communications team as a Communications Officer. The position calls for a passion for storytelling and an ability to deploy a wide variety of strategies and tactics to achieve goals across various institutional and programmatic goals. We seek individuals with superior interpersonal, project management and communication skills and a proven ability to work and lead effectively as part of a team. This position can be located in Bentonville, AR; Denver, CO; Jersey City, NJ; or Washington, D.C.

About the Position

The Communications Officer will work across the institution and programs to develop strategy for and run multi-channel communications campaigns in service of diverse objectives. This individual will manage the foundation’s social media profiles and website and regularly analyze and report on campaign and digital platform performance. They will keep current on digital communications trends and emerging innovations advising communications staff and Foundation leadership on whether and how to apply to WFF work. The position will report to the Communications Deputy Director and work closely with the communications team and consultants, as well as with program and administrative staff from across the Foundation.

Specific duties will include:

  • Develop and execute strategic communications campaigns that advance the Foundation’s goals across existing and new channels
  • Support campaign strategy, execution and measurement of owned communications efforts for the K-12 Education, Environment and Home Region programs
  • Grow and cultivate a diverse, engaged audience through digital and owned channels
  • Utilize existing or new monitoring and reporting strategies to measure impact of digital and campaign efforts
  • Leverage digital media monitoring or reporting tools to proactively identify opportunities and anticipate challenges
  • Develop and manage an editorial calendar and storytelling strategy to increase awareness of and support for the Foundation and grantees
  • Manage the Foundation’s website. Oversee content generation, publishing, design, tracking of analytics, platform upgrades and integration into other services
  • Manage digital development, social media and (as needed) creative vendors to optimize performance aligned with Foundation and program goals
  • Spearhead the development of creative assets for digital channels, including videos and graphics, with external partners
  • Create opportunities using new tools, platforms and resources to help the Foundation and programs reach their objectives

Who we are looking for

  • Builder of effective relationships and networks to achieve results
  • Excellent writing skills, with keen ability to distill complicated ideas into clear, understandable messages
  • Clear understanding of how to set and implement strategy
  • Ability to manage projects from conception to execution
  • Insight to know which stakeholders to incorporate into different projects at different times
  • Incorporate feedback from multiple stakeholders while moving projects forward
  • A problem solver who is outcome oriented
  • Expert at juggling multiple tasks and priorities based on the impact on overall goals
  • Creative and can produce great content without having to outsource
  • Constantly iterating to achieve improved outcomes
  • An ambassador with the ability to give and receive feedback graciously
  • Superior communicator who treats everyone with respect
  • Intellectual agility and the ability to analyze, think critically and understand emerging issues that are directly relevant to quality of life initiatives 
  • Unquestionable ethics and personal integrity
  • Effective team member who is also able to act independently and deliver with limited guidance
  • Willingness to make a passionate commitment to the goals of the Walton Family Foundation
  • Ability to travel

 Basic qualifications required for your success

  • A commitment to the mission of the Walton Family Foundation
  • At least three years’ experience in a professional setting, ideally with a strong focus on organic and paid digital strategy, content creation or multi-channel communications campaigns
  • Advanced proficiency with website management, digital tools and associated platforms
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to create compelling online stories, both narratively and visually
  • Experience leveraging owned channels in service of complex advocacy goals
  • A strong understanding of optimizing digital content in order to build audiences and drive engagement
  • Ability to stay abreast of the latest social media tactics, platform updates and enhancements, strategies and best practices
  • Ability to analyze social content performance and optimize future communications accordingly
  • Ability to be a self-starter; experience and aptitude managing long-distance internal and external relationships
  • Unquestionable ethics and personal integrity
  • Diplomatic approach and an innate understanding of customer service
  • Demonstrated competency with graphic arts layout, print and development experience. Strong familiarity with cutting-edge content management systems, Adobe Design Suite, Microsoft Office and the latest trends in digital analytics.
  • A high level of discretion and confidentiality for both business and personal affairs

About the Walton Family Foundation  

The Walton Family Foundation is at its core, a family-led foundation. Three generations of the descendants of our founders, Sam and Helen Walton, and their spouses, work together to lead the foundation and create access to opportunity for people and communities. We work in three areas: improving K-12 education, protecting rivers and oceans and the communities they support, and investing in our home region of Northwest Arkansas and the Arkansas-Mississippi Delta. To learn more, visit Walton Family Foundation.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to embedding diversity, equity, and inclusion throughout the organization to foster an environment where all associates THRIVE and belong. We do this by creating:

  • a culture committed to continuous learning that recognizes and values differences
  • an environment of respect and connection to learn from the richness of identities, experiences, and perspectives
  • fair access for all to opportunities for growth and advancement

Compensation and Benefits

Compensation Range: $96,000 - $120,000

Benefits Information: We offer a comprehensive and generous benefits package which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401 (k) retirement plan and paid time off.

node.description:
Position Overview

Shire Post Mint is seeking a full-time hourly employee to assist in the production of authentic fantasy coins. This position reports to the Chief Coin Wizard (Manufacturing Manager) but also works closely with fellow Coin Smiths and other departments.

Start Date: This position is scheduled to begin on or around October 1, 2021.

Location: This is an on-site position with no remote options. The company is located in West Fork, Arkansas.

Position Responsibilities

A Coin Smith at Shire Post Mint helps make awesome coins. Duties will include:

  • Operating coin presses
  • Machinery operation
  • Machinery setup
  • Material finishing
  • General cleanup and shop maintenance
  • Transporting finished coins
  • Packaging and shipping support
  • Other recording, tracking

Key Characteristics

A successful Coin Smith is:

  • Communicative: seeking help and direction and providing feedback and interaction
  • Agile and adaptable: willing to pivot to address changing priorities and also provide support to other departments when needed.
  • A learner: the wonderful world of coinage has endless possibilities, so a Coin Smith should always be seeking ways to improve their trade.
  • A person who takes lots of initiative in both helping others and asking for help.
  • Creative problem solving
  • A hard worker: someone who gets things done and looks for the next task or project to accomplish.
  • Personally accountable - shows up on time, takes ownership of issues, has a sense of pride and responsibility in work, not hiding mistakes, but learning from them.

Preferred Qualifications/Licenses

  • Driver’s License preferred

Compensation and Benefits:

Hourly Rate: $15 per hour starting rate, 30-40 hours per week. Performance is evaluated every six months with opportunity for raises.

Benefits: This position offers medical insurance paid 100% for the employee. Additional options include insurance for family members and vision and dental plans and would be the responsibility of the employee. These benefits are available after the first three months of contiguous full-time employment. This position also offers a 401k plan with up to 4% match. This benefit is available after the first six months of contiguous full-time employment.

Physical Requirements: Physical labor. Operating heavy machinery (coin presses). Must be able to remain in a stationary position most of the time and move throughout the workshop. Must be able to operate office equipment and presses and ascend/descend stairs. Will require some lifting/transporting equipment (up to 50 pounds) around the workshop and load into vehicles. Must be able to converse, perceive, and communicate information verbally and visually.

Disclaimer: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Shire Post Mint is a workplace that affirms queer/transgender/gender nonconforming persons. We provide a work environment that is very supportive of the LGBTQIA+ community and we are looking for team members that contribute to this supportive environment.
